Reviews.Title: “wonderful place”
Reviews.Author: Roger340
Reviews.Content: This is our 2nd visit to the DBR stayed one month, great hotel, near access to the beach beautiful beach 3 swimming pool, internet Near everything: restaurant, pharmacy, grocerie shop ( across the street) staff at the front desk were very pleasant and frendly Specially chelsea, she is the best at the front desk, Always smiling and polite very kind i will go back soon

Reviews.Title: “Good but not great.....”
Reviews.Author: abragl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this resort for the Labor Day weekend. All in all we had a nice time but this property could take some tips from some of the Hilton Grand Vacation properties we have stayed at in the past. The property was not as clean as it could have been , for example there was a red Solo cup in one of the elevators that stayed there for 2 days before it was cleaned up. The doors to the lobby were filthy and filled with smudges and hand prints, same for the elevators. When we got back to the property from dinner one evening we were greeted by an obviously intoxicated young lady from ther balcony with a megaphone screaming at everyone that it was her birthday while you tried to get into the resort from the parking lot. The pool restrooom had one of the toilet paper dispensers ripped off the wall and was absolutely filthy, our room smelled like mildew, and really could have used some updating. I did get a service at the spa and the nicest way I can phrase it is that it was really lacking in professionalism and service level. While the service I had was satisfactory, the staff at the spa itself could use some polish. Also, there really should be a changing area with towels, lockers, etc. I feel like having to go across the lobby to the public restroom before my treatment sort of takes away from the experience. I can't even tell you the name of my thearapist because she never introduced herself to me. The in house restaurant was horrible, I would not recommend the breakfast buffet to anyone, ever. We didn't dare attempt another meal on property after that experience. On the plus side, the pools were great, very family friendly and they offered a ton of activities for families throughout the day. They offered a Luau that sounded like a great time, but we were weary of the food after our breakfast experience, so we did not try it. All in all not a horrible experience, but we will probably not be back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay at DBR”
Reviews.Author: Danielle H
Reviews.Content: We loved the view from our room and liked the location. Close to downtown but not right in the middle of it so it was pretty quiet. Didn't find it to be very clean but it was average. Very small fitness room.

Reviews.Title: “overall its nice if i could g”
Reviews.Author: CameronJP
Reviews.Content: this is a nice hotel the team members are very nice to me this is one of the nicest hotel i stayed at in the area this hotel is a little bit out of the pier area nice quiet area there is a Publix across the street (supermarket) i can't say anything about dining but the food looks very good we had virgin Pina coladas from the poolside bar (they do serve Non virgin Pina coladas and other drinks) there is a indoor pool + 2 outdoor pools + a kiddie pool. the indoor pool is there for nothing because its closes when thunder storms happen the coach and the one seater sofa were very un comfortable place some blankets on them so overall if i could give it a 3 half i would

Reviews.Title: “Daytona Beach, Florida”
Reviews.Author: rumrunner58
Reviews.Content: I wanted to return to Daytona Beach, Florida since I went there last when I was 11 years old and my parents took my brothers and me there. (I am now 54 yrs. old and I was born and raised in Miami, Florida and I still live here!). We stayed at the Daytona Beach Resort and Conference Center (DBR). I had a great time remembering the fabulous surf, the wonderful people and the laid-back experience of taking a beach vacation. I took my wife and two kids (my daughter is 9 yrs. old and my son is 11). We went on 8/4/12 and left on 8/7/12. On the first day, we unleashed the kids into the ocean and all 3 of the hotel's fabulous outdoor pools, the kids pool, (which has those "mushroom structures" that rain water down upon the children like at the waterparks), or the indoor pool or their 2 indoor hot tubs right next to the indoor pool, After a day at the beach and the pools, and two hours before sunset, take your car and turn right out of the hotel (North), go slow and find a street on your right that takes you down to the beach. Turn right and you are headed to the boardwalk. Maintain the speed limit of 10 mph and roll down your windows. What a ride----driving on a beach!!!!!! Fabulous!!!!. When you get to the boardwalk there are many T-shirt shops, a small go-kart track, a Ferris Wheel, a video and parlor game arcade, fast food shops and other stores, This boardwalk is on the beach!! So you should only wear T-shirts, Hawaiian shirts, shorts, sun dresses, sandals or flip-flops.. If that's not enough, you can stay at the hotel and slather on more sun block and stay by the water or you can take a 45 minute trip north to St. Augustine.and visit the Oldest Wooden School House in America ($4.95 per adult and something less for young kids...yes, the State of Florida charges school age children to visit the Oldest Wooden School House...never understood that policy---charging children to visit a school.) There are many other wonderful attractions to visit in St. Augustine so visit. www.augustine.com. St. Augustine is a very old city, so it is very small. You really don't have to buy those trolley tickets to ride around the city and see it if you are in good to fair physical condition. (But I must say, for $55.00 it was probably worth it for my family to jump on and off the train just to get the breeze in your face and cool off on a hot August afternoon.. (Also, the tour guides who drive the trolleys give you alot more historical information then you might get out of a history book). Of course, the Fountain of Youth discoverd by Juan Ponce de Leon is located in St. Augustine. This park is just a mile or so north of the old city. There is free parking there or, if you buy the trolley tickets, it's one of the stops. (Do not expect something like Niagara Falls, it's more like one of your kids leaving your garden hose at half-on. But hey!.. It's the Fountain of Youth and they let you taste the water!!!). If you still want to stay at the hotel and slather on more sun block and stay by the water you can do that, or you can take a 45 minute trip south to the Kennedy Space Center. If you have never been there or you have kids, it's an amazing place. Buy the cheapest entry fee you can get, ($45.per adult and $35 for children 3-11 yrs. old--a bit pricey for what you get since NASA is not launching shuttles anymore). You will get a narrated bus ride around the VAB (Vehicle Assembly Building) and see the "crawler" that takes assembled rockets to the launch pad. They also have the Apollo/Saturn V rocket museum which is amazing The IMAX movies are great! You can easily spend 7 hours there. The food costs about the same as a movie theater. But hey!.. you're on vacation!!! Orlando, and those wonderful theme parks, are about 1 hour away. But that's another vacation review that I'm sure you have already read about! Please read below for some tips!!!! Tips: !) Daytona Beach is known for "Spring Break", "Bike Week" (when motorcyclists come to Daytona Beach, but they can fill up the hotel rooms fast and I'm sure the hotels cost more!) Furthermore, in the winter time, NASCAR comes to town! It's a great time for racing fans but that event can fill up rooms fast as well. 2.)Take advantage of "off periods" and there are plenty of them! Go to www.daytonabeach.com and download their visitor's guide. It has the schedule of the events I described above and you can work around those dates and get some pretty good prices.. 3) At the Daytona Beach Reort and Conference Center, I would recommend getting the 1 bedroom suite. What the DBR did was take a room facing the ocean and knocked out the wall to the room facing the street. Then they took out the second bathroom (in the room facing the ocean) and made a kitchen out of it). The rest of the room that faces the ocean they made into a family area. The room that faces the street, (which is very far away from the street and, as such, you cannot hear traffic noise) has two queen beds, which were very comfortable. This resort is 2.5 miles north of the boardwalk. Perfect!!! Away from the noise and bright lights. Very easy to drive to the boardwalk, by beach or road. 4.) Take advantage of the suite's amenities. The suite has plates, cups and utensils. It also has a small microwave oven, a full size refrigerator and dual stove-top oven and a coffee maker. There are many grocery stores in the neighborhood of the DBR. Buy bread, milk, juices, water, cold cuts, cereal,etc. Save a little money on breakfast, lunch and dinner by buying for "in-house" meals. But I must say, the restaurant in the lobby is very good and, for a beach resort, fairly priced! 5) Parking is free. But the staff will not tell you about the "resort fee" which is $16.88 per day/per room until you check out. So add that into the cost per day for the room when you plan your stay. Overall, our stay was excellent! We will do this trip again

Reviews.Title: “Fairly good size suite. Real tight kitchen. Old Couches and Carpet. Good value for money if you bring cleaning supplies.”
Reviews.Author: Fishhawkers
Reviews.Content: Wifi in room was not good. Carpet could be replaced. Couches and sofas are horrible, we covered them with blankets. Beds are comfy. Pots and pans worn. We went and bought our own. Overal kinda dirty, when we first got in a ran to Walgreens for cleaners and cleaned all furniture, kitchen, fridge, balcony windows, tables, light switches, doorknobs and etc.lack of care in overall cleanliness made me worry wether sheets were changed between guests, Pools nice but have algae problems, especially indoor pool. Parking was right next to our room. Front desk staff nice. Overal good value.

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed, great value!”
Reviews.Author: lbyrd2
Reviews.Content: My family and I came across Daytona Beach Resort online while looking for a condo to rent. There were no condos available for the time slot we were looking for in our price range. We noticed how nice the hotel looked and how great the prices were so we decided to book for 4 nights. We were honestly a little sceptical because of the price being so good. We figured we would take the chance! DBR did not disappoint. There are 4 nice size pools with a tiki bar in the center of it all. We stayed in a suite that slept all 5 of us comfortably. Customer service was great and check in and out was a breeze. Nothing was a hassle and that's very rare to find anywhere you go now days! Every level of the parking garage had 2 hotel entrances to make parking and coming and going very convenient (and safe being you would use your room key to get in.) We will definitely be returning. We paid much less than we did for other comparable hotels and we were much happier. Home run!

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are nasty as all get out.”
Reviews.Author: fpdtd
Reviews.Content: Our first room we stayed in was not clean, hair on sink, mildew in shower/ tub. Shower handle was broke , it was to small for family of four so we upgraded to a 2 bedroom suite, carpet had dark brown stains, grout in bath and kitchen black from lack of cleaning shower same as last room mildew on wall and floor of shower, shower drained water slow oh and to top it off my wife killed a roach in our bedroom.. The cleanliness of the lobby area was the best hmmm I wonder why... Best part was view of the beach..

Reviews.Title: “Great Weekend in Daytona Beach”
Reviews.Author: retailrat
Reviews.Content: Booked a weekend getaway here at the Daytona Beach Resort & Conference Center. Check-in was fast, however, there were no luggage carts available to get our bags and such to the room. The parking lot was full so we opted for the parking garage and found it was right near our room so after several trips we got all our belongings in. Room was a decent size and clean. Kitchen area had a full size refrigerator, microwave and two burner stove. Balcony was right over pool #3. It was a little bit noisy at times but not bad. Pool #3 was a smoking pool and being on floor 2, the smoke drifted to the balcony causing us to stay inside until the pool closed. All in all a very comfortable room, bed was great and we will definitely come back to this resort again.

Reviews.Title: “Was just OK - needs some tuning to make it a WOW”
Reviews.Author: mcsunshine
Reviews.Content: This is our 2nd visit to the DBR, within a few years. On this occasion, more so than the last, it was very noticeable on the diminished level of service. The rooms were nice and access to the beach was great. Had it not been for that, the rating would have been a 1 star. The level of service and housekeeping really needs to step up their game. When we arrived in the evening, we had a very nice time at the pool bar getting a dinner tip from the bartenders. Loved the bartenders at the pool bar. They were nice and helpful when we had questions about places in the area. Also, provided great drink suggestions. The pool area had a DJ which was nice to hear music and activities. However, when we woke in the morning and went to shower, we noticed there were no soaps, shampoos or other bathroom amenities. It was about 7:45am. We called down to the hotel desk and they told us we would have to go down to the desk ourselves, since housekeeping didn’t start until 8am. Very disappointing. Also, our room wasn’t cleaned until around 5pm!!! When you stay at the beach, you tend to pop in and out of the room in the day – to come up and see a room with the beds not made and no fresh towels, when you pay a handsome fee – is again, disappointing. Breakfast was nothing special – and we ended going somewhere else, since it didn’t look appetizing at all. Coffee was really bad too. To sum it up – the next time I go to Daytona, I will stay at another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad but with a little improvement could be so much better”
Reviews.Author: 1momof3boys
Reviews.Content: I was excited to find a place that fit our family of 5 and had a separate bedroom with a pull out sofa. This place has nice pools, great beach access, lots of parking and a nice, clean room. However, we booked a room for 5 people and got 3 towels. Had to call for more. Then, at 10pm at night when we pulled out the sofa bed we realized that there were no linens at all for it in the room so we had to call again and it took 45 min. Also, one morning I decided to make breakfast in the room. Although you have a kitchen, it was sparse. There were place settings and silver for 4 people. I could not find a spatula or even a large frying pan. Not a big deal for many people, but when you are staying with larger family, you should have these things available. I agree that the wireless was spotty, The room was a decent size and had nice tv's and a huge bathroom. It wasn't a bad experience, but they could really improve with a few things.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad but it could have been better”
Reviews.Author: samantha m
Reviews.Content: my friends and i (there was 6 of us) stayed here for 5 nights. we stayed in a suite on the 5th floor on the south side. ill start with the good we never had a problem with housekeeping, any time we needed extra towels or sheets we got them from the front desk or housekeeping brought them to us.the staff is super nice. the hot tub was hot. having beach access was wonderful. there is a publix and a walgreens across the street The Bad the rooms could have been cleaned a little better, they really should consider replacing the carpet and sofa bed,there is no oven, don't be fooled by the pictures the suite is on the small side. the wifi in the south tower is bad you have to sit on the balcony or go to the lobby to get good signal. the balcony on the south side is shared. there is a refundable $100 deposit that they did not tell us about and we called a few times before our check in date and asked if there was any other charges. in the mornings people put towels on the pool side chairs to claim them so by the afternoon you cant find a unclaimed chair.

Reviews.Title: “Wireless and Chorline Issue”
Reviews.Author: Denise R
Reviews.Content: I will start out with the good. The rooms were very clean, service was very good. The pools were awful, both indoor and outdoors. I left Friday morning and was only in the pool once for about 10 minutes and my eyes still hurt from the chorline that was in them. When you enter the lobby you will automatically know what I am talking about as that is the smell when you come into the lobby. Also one of the reasons we selected this hotel was for the wireless capability. Got to our room and found out that the wireless was not working. Found out later it was that there was poor coverage in the area of our room. Had already unpacked for a week stay and did not want to move as was an option given. I think what was the kicker for me was when the front desk person told me they had wireless. I asked him why I was in his lobby with my laptop when I have wireless in my room. He stated again that the hotel has wireless and I again told him if it did why do I have to come out of my room to go to the lobby for this service. He stated he would have maintaince look at it. Never happened. If you stay at DBR and need wireless service, I found out later you must stay in the north rooms as the south room are not covered. Hope this helps anyone that may have eye issues or may need wireless when looking for a place to stay in DB.

Reviews.Title: “overall a good hotel”
Reviews.Author: vacation8
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed the location of the hotel, which was located right on the beach. Walgreens and Publix were also right across the street. Our room had 2 queen beds, a pull out couch, a kitchenette with a full sized refrigerator, and a large bathroom with double sinks. Our beds were very comfortable. I would have given a 5 star review, but the housekeeping staff never seemed to leave enough towels, soap, trash bags, etc. Our room slept six, but we were only left 3 towels. The front desk was very polite and would bring up whatever supplies we needed when called. We were also charged a $15/day resort fee upon checkout that was not included in our original room rate.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back next summer!”
Reviews.Author: jdubya57
Reviews.Content: Had a minor mix-up with room assignment after making reservations 4 months in advance. I reserved one of the "Executive Club Oceanview Suites" which, according to the description, had a separate bedroom (with either 2 queens or one king) and a pull-out sofa and full kitchen in the main living room area. When we checked in on July 8, we were assigned basically two adjoining studios, each with its own kitchenette and bath, except one had two queens and the other a king with a pull-out sofa. This set-up, although awkward (having 2 kitchenettes), actually worked out better for our party of 4. The only complaint I have is the balconies were standing room only, with one exception--the room my wife and I stayed in was a corner room and the balcony actually wrapped around the corner of the building and overlooked the street and that part of the balcony was large enough to set out some chairs, if looking down at the street from 13 stories high is your thing! LOL. The bedding in the executive club suites is superb, so if comfort is an issue, I would recommend staying one of these!

Reviews.Title: “Not the best, however not the worst”
Reviews.Author: JLphotographyonline
Reviews.Content: Hello I just got back from DBR less than 2 hours ago. My wife and I stay from last Sunday (7/15) thru Saturday(7/21). We booked this hotel through Bookit.com and didn't have any problem with check in or our Universal and Islands of Adventure Passes. (BTW I highly recommend to get those through Bookit.com if you're booking your stay through them.) Having read some reviews on the hotel before leaving I was not sure what we were going to be getting into. Now I'm going to do my best to give a full review of this hotel for everyone. Hotel: Yes this hotel is a little older, however Daytona is a little older town than your typical beach town so don't hold that against the hotel. Now that being said the resort could upgrade the Mattresses. I'm not sure if it's every room, but our room 219 (King suite) the mattress was AWFUL. I woke up monday with a stiff neck from the springy mattress and flat pillows. The mattress in our room was wore out and needed to be replaced. It was bad enough that we were going to use the fold out couch to sleep on for the rest of the week, but guess what it was crappy to. Sunday when we arrived the moment I walked through the day there was a slight smell to the room, my wife couldn't smell it but it was the smell of a light body odor I guess you would say. Now after monday I don't know if It went away or if I got use to it, however I couldn't smell it anymore. Cleanliness: Other than the slight smell in the room the first couple of days the room was pretty clean at check in. Beds were made, dishes put up Etc. However, the inner shower curtain should be replaced, there was mold on it. IN ROOM SAFE: our room DID NOT have a in room safe, not sure about the others, I would assume they do not, but I do not know. Because of this we keep our DO NOT DISTURB sign on the door so the maids would not come into the room. Having Jewelry and my professional camera equipment for photography in the room we didn't want to chance anything. Privacy: We did have a balcony on our room that you could sit on, however like one reviewer stated before it's like they turned an outside entrance into the balcony's and there is NO wall between you and your neighbors just railing. So no walking out on the balcony naked J/K lol. The walls are pretty thin, our neighbors had a toddler and she liked to run from one end of the room to the other early in the morning and it was like she was in the room with us. Also the last night we were their some of our drunk neighbors 3 rooms down decided to come into the halls and talk extremely loud and we could hear every word they were saying at 1AM. GYM: Now I know most people don't work out on their vacation, however I do still like to train a few days a week while on vacation. Now if you're like me i'd suggest get a week pass at Planet Fitness 2 blocks down, cause it's not a gym, I wouldn't even call it a fitness center. They have a treadmill and elipical and 2 machines with some weight on them, but no free weights. POOLS: 2 pools outside 8ft-3.5ft and then one kiddy type pool also outside, then one pool inside with 2 hot tubs. Also like other reviewers, the inside pool has ALOT of chemicals in it and they do burn your eyes a bit if you get water in your eyes. POOLSIDE bar: We only got 1 drink and it was over priced and weak. STAFF: There are a few reviews that state they staff is rude, I did not experience this. BEACH: The beach was nice. It may be crowded to some, however for what my wife and I are use to it was extremely calm and that made the 8 hour drive worth it. Conclusion: Having stayed in standard hotels and 5 star all inclusive resorts I give DBR a 3.5 out of 5 and could easily be a 4 if they were to update a few things.

Reviews.Title: “I'd go back :)”
Reviews.Author: Teri S
Reviews.Content: This was a nice hotel, with a great size pool. Access to the beach was perfect. Nice bar outside and inside. Rooms were spacious and clean. Staff was friendly. I would definately go back. Family friendly and could go as a couple or alone.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: Jenjojo
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 1 night while in town for a race at Daytona Speedway. Rooms were clean and spacious. Beds were comfortable and a/c worked great. Front desk staff friendly and accomodating. Pool was slightly heated as was shower wash off . The ONLY thing negative I can say is the bar staff out by the pool were unfriendly and seemed miserable. Get some friendlier staff out there and this hotel is rated a 5.

Reviews.Title: “cancellation policy”
Reviews.Author: gerri s
Reviews.Content: I just wanted to pass on a complaint regarding cancellation of a reservation I needed to make last minute due to a unforseen emergency beyond my control. I booked a room for 2 nights checking in 7/6 and checking out 7/8. I tried to call as soon as possible (3:30 am on 7/6), when I spoke with the reservation desk, I was told to call back at 9:00 am, he could not make reservations or cancel them, so I had to call Hotels.com directly. I told the customer service rep that I had a unforseen emergency and needed to cancel my reservations, I was told I would still be billed for 1 night, then I asked if I could just change the dates to another weekend and was told I would still be charged for 1 night. I am very unhappy, I was willing to still pay the same rate I booked for and was looking forward to staying at your hotel. Due to your not wanting to make exceptions in emergency cases, ($210 is alot of money) I will not be recommending your hotel to friends and family, who stay in Daytona frequently, and will ask them not to recommend either. I will use facebook to get the message out.

Reviews.Title: “Good & bad”
Reviews.Author: Sherleej
Reviews.Content: I'll just bullet point this. Good points: *Clean rooms *Great atmosphere *Pool area is wonderful *Beachfront rooms have great views *Staff is very friendly *Great decor *Price is very good for what you get Bad points *When they say 4:00 check in, they mean it, do NOT arrive early, it won't help. We got there at 1 for 2 rooms. The first room was available at 3:10, the 2nd at 4 on the nose. *Housekeeping does not come until after 3 every day. Our 2 rooms were no where near each other & this was true for both *Don't wait til you need towels to call for them. We called twice & it took over an hour to get. *Housekeeping does not leave you what you need for next day. The first day they were out of washcloths & the 2nd day we didn't get a bathmat *Ice maker on our floor did not work. Pain in the butt to have to go down a floor to get ice then come back up. Overall I would stay again, but the good does come with the bad.

Reviews.Title: “Old & Worn Out”
Reviews.Author: jacqueline3276
Reviews.Content: The room was small, could have done without the kitchen, and the bathroom was tiny. The staff were friendly but I would'nt stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed an extra 4 days it was so great!”
Reviews.Author: elizabethrCharlotte
Reviews.Content: What a lovely place! I enjoyed myself so much that I end up staying extra days, by myself, without friends, it was so great. The rooms, food, location were awesome. This is the place I will go back to!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice pool area!”
Reviews.Author: gogogo1234-1
Reviews.Content: This was our 4th stay at this hotel. We like the location on the beach and Publix/Walgreens across the street. Room was not as clean as in past and was not cleaned daily as well as in past but overall we enjoyed our stay. I like palm trees, just not right in front of our view of the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Great place...great views!”
Reviews.Author: bronxfanz
Reviews.Content: Stayed in an oceanfront room on the 2nd floor. Very clean, very friendly staff. Laundry facilities right on our floor..very convenient. A little too far from the Boardwalk, not in walking distance. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: vintagebabe67
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our stay at this hotel. It was exceeded our expections. All staff very friendly and helpful. Always greeted you with a smile. The food was very good and portions large for the price. Outside bar was a plus and the bartendeWe lucked out and had a room right by the elevator and parking right outside the room. GREAT! I can't say enough good about this hotel. I would recommend this hotel to friends and relatives. Our hats off to the management! Keep up the good work. We will be back

Reviews.Title: “True Daytona resort”
Reviews.Author: theallards
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled the first weekend in May 2012, we traveled as part of the Florida Firefighter games, we arrived and were checked in promptly, this was key because at the time I was on crutches from breaking my leg, the resort staff was friendly, one of the gentleman even offered to keep the hot tub part of the pool access open late or early for me while we were there! The room was clean and the kitchen was stocked well. I was surprised to find so many pots and pans, a full size coffee maker and plenty of towels in a hotel room. The only downside while we were there the resort was completely booked one evening, there was the large group of firefighters, a wedding and a prom going on all at the same time. We came back from being at the soccer fields for the day and were ready to get cleaned up, it was in the mid 90's, hot for this time of year, there wasn't a place to park. We were told to park across the street at Denny's.

Reviews.Title: “very nice property”
Reviews.Author: jack71570
Reviews.Content: very nice place. we stayed in room 810. great view and was exceptionally clean and well supplied. ALL the staff were very professional. the only thing i did not like was that the chairs and umbrellas on the beach were $30 per day.... this is not the resorts fault, but i was an added expense... the location of this property could not be better..... walking distance to almost anything... dont waste your time going to the pier as it is not completed yet....we are hopefully returning to DBR in july......

Reviews.Title: “Best customer service ever.”
Reviews.Author: HappiGurl
Reviews.Content: Very nice oceanfront property, tiki bar is great feature. Mixup with room assignment was quickly and generously made right by manager, Michael. He is the picture of what a hospitality manager should be, and then some. Kitchen was well-supplied and all was clean and comfortable. We will stay here whenever we are in Daytona Beach, it is hands-down the nicest and best value we've found there.

Reviews.Title: “Could've been cleaner”
Reviews.Author: Nadine W
Reviews.Content: Stepped out of the 9th floor elevator to the smell of wet/mold. The carpet in the room was wet after being cleaned and stayed that way until we checked out 3 days later which made everything feel damp/sticky. I wore shoes the entire inside stay. Could never get the a/c on a comfortable temp and left the patio door open for the most part of the stay. The outside pool and areas seemed clean enough but I could never stay inside the indoor pool area long enough for a look around as the chlorine burned my eyes and nose. Room service seemed okay although there was a large hairball on the kitchen floor when we arrived and they didn't have clean towels on the cart when asked...this prompted a walk down to the front desk. Front desk staff friendly and accommodating. All in all it was worth the price we paid, the area was near a shopping center, newspaper deliver, and easy beach access and a decently supplied kitchen (no oven). Onsite restaurant prices typical, food decent. Will probably stay again with the family.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay, nice property”
Reviews.Author: GeorgeW
Reviews.Content: Modern room, 2 queen beds, apt sized fridge/icemaker, microwave, coffemaker, dishes/glassware/utensils, etc. Free ice machines, each floor, free parking in covered garage or nearer building. Tiki bar with food/bev service, 3 pools (1indoor heated), free business center, free wifi throughout property, local newspaper delivered to room. Across from Denny's, shopping center with Publix market, Walgreens, etc. Only complaints: -So-called 7th floor "oceanfront room" actually overlooked front parking lot with view of ocean in distance, beyond perpendicular main building. - Decent $3.50 domestic bottled beer price @ bar jumped to $5 at Sat night ballroom function.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best resorts we know!”
Reviews.Author: Pascal M
Reviews.Content: Very nice resort right on the long and beautiful beach of Daytona Beach. Access and exit to the beach is right next to the resort ($ 5 all day). Opposite the Resort is a shopping center with Publix and Walgreens. The resort complex is very well and the rooms are very comfortable. The indoor pool temperature is really pleasant. We only missed an in-room safe (it is available at the reception). The resort is well suited for several days, because it really has it all. Very good value for money, we will always return to this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: judybear49
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from spending 4 beautiful days there. The oceanfront King room was great and what a view. The tiki bar was nice and we really enjoyed the location. It is in easy walking distance to several really nice places to eat. We only had one meal at the hotel and it was fine and the price very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: Hamzy
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two days this past week. Easy to find following the directions on Google Maps. Right on the beach with easy access. It was not busy at the time I was there so service was quick and friendly. I was able to check in quickly and find a good parking spot in the garage. Room was comfortable. The air conditioner could have been better but since I am not from an area with the ocean, I left the door open so I could have the ocean sound and breeze. The balcony is very small. There were two chairs, however I am not sure how you would use them on the tiny balcony. The staff in the restaurant was gracious and attentive. The only complaint I had was that the second night there was a "reception" in the restaurant which is not very big and it was very loud and noisy. I think it is a little over priced but I guess since it is on Daytona Beach, that is probably the going rate. All in all it was a pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Beautiful View”
Reviews.Author: Clrock
Reviews.Content: My Mother and I stayed here the second week of April. Overall this hotel is a good value - rooms are spacious and the 'kitchen' helps keep the cost of eating out on vacation down. We had an ocean view room and really enjoyed the balcony. The parking garage was very convenient and we never had to worry about having somewhere to park. The pool and beach areas were both nice - some of the staff at the pool bar struggled with communicating in English. Cleanliness was average - we had to call to get coffee replaced and we ran out of toliet paper as it was not stocked. The shower has very little water pressure but the water was always hot. Resturant food was a little overpriced and the service was slow. Our biggest compliant was noise - the walls in this hotel are not thick enough to drown out voices from the hallway or in the next room. It was very difficult to sleep. We would recommend and would like to stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Timothy G
Reviews.Content: We had a short time to plan a quick vacation and ended up choosing the Daytona Beach Resort, mainly due to the many great reviews. When we arrived, the staff was quick and efficient. We checked into our room which was a bit tight (tiny bathroom!) but adequate. It was very clean, but unfortunatly, smelled moldy. Being alergic to mold, that was not a good omen! When we headed out to get dinner, we stopped at the front desk and I spoke with Michael. He apologized and asked if he could put an ionizer in the room while we were out to help reduce the mold. He also said that he would move us to another room in the section that had been recently redone where he guaranteed that there would be no mold. When we retruned to our room, the mold was much less evedent. In the morning, Michael had already arranged to move us (the hotel was sold out the night before). He also mentioned that he would be happy to move us to a suite, but could not do so without a slight additional fee. When he told me the cost, I jumped at the opportunity. What a GREAT deal it turned out to be. Worth every penny!! We moved to a suit on the 6th floor of the tower. What a view. The oceanfront room with a balcony, kitchen (full sized refrig, glass top burners and microwave as well as a toaster) bedroom and great bathroom made our stay awesome! We loved every minute! We will look forward to returning in the future as this was a great choice of hotels! The housekeeping staff was also excellent! The pools were great (if you want a chair on the weekend, get down to the pool early!). If you want a lot of sun, sit on the South East side of the deck as that area has the sun the longerst. That end of the deck is also non-smoking while the North end allows smoking. There is a fire pit at night which is nice. The beach is right through a gate and is a great place to take long walks. Overall, we were exceptionally happy with our stay. Michael (what a great employee!) was right - we were not dissappointed with our suite! Our one regret is that we could only stay for 6 nights!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place - Fair Price”
Reviews.Author: TravelerDiderBoy
Reviews.Content: Room was clean with nice kitchen area, parking garage, fast elevators, nice pool bar with simple food available. Workers were friendly, professional, helpful and nice. Beach was not crowded and umbrella/chair rentals available at a reasonable price. Most area restaruants are within a mile drive. Easy to navigate in this uncongested city. We would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Off Season Hit - with the family!”
Reviews.Author: thewizardofawes
Reviews.Content: As a father of three little ones, I am always looking for a safe and relaxing place that lives up to my standards of a vacation. The Daytona Beach Resort and Conference Center fit the bill perfectly for us. It is a beachfront hotel, located on the northern end of Daytona Beach. There were three slightly heated pools (one indoor), a firepit, outdoor tiki bar, restaraunt, and a few steps to the beach. We stayed in one of the larger suites which had a small kitchen, couch, table, and then a seperate sleeping area (although it is really all just one big room). The property was very clean, quiet, and there were not a lot of people when we were there in Feburary. The hotel has a parking garage which allows you to park on your floor which is handy if you have a lot of stuff to carry in. There is also a very nice putt-putt one block away, McDonalds two blocks away, a Denny's grocery store, and beach shop across the street. Very handy for a family. Items to note: Keep in mind that Daytona Beach has hard sand, not really the soft fluffly sea shell kind of place. Daytona Beach also allows cars to drive on the beach, which may also be a turn off for some, especially during the busy season. If you are going to the Daytona Speedway it is about 15 minutes from the hotel. If you are driving to Disney World it will only take about an hour. I wish I was still there!

Reviews.Title: “A+”
Reviews.Author: Ludzygirl
Reviews.Content: I was very skeptical after reading some bad reviews on here. My boyfriend and I planned a last minute trip to Daytona and for Easter week there were obviously slim pickings. Well I definitely am thankful that I picked DBR! I had originally chosen a riverview room which wasn't horrible but it was very small and just wasn't what I wanted. So I called the front desk and asked how much it would be for an upgrade. Well It was extremely reasonable so I figured why not? Let me tell you that it was so worth it. We had the oceanfront king suite and we were blown away. Awesome view, clean, huge, the whole ten. We went to the publix across the street and got food to cook for breakfast and lunch so we could save money. That worked out really well also. We spent almost every day down at the beach or the pool! Just keep in mind that this hotel is not in walking distance to very many bars or restaurants, we had to cab it alot of places. I also highly recommend the restaurant caffeine in Ormond beach, wing house, Mai tai's and the ocean deck! All in all, I would definitely recommend this hotel!! P.S. Chelsea at the front desk rocks!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Weekend”
Reviews.Author: Mai S
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel is absoulutely phenomenal! I had two oceanfront suites in the south end of the resort. If anyone needed anyhing, such as towels, the staff had it sent within a couple minutes. I have never had such great service. I stayed at the resort during Easter weekend and the resort had several activities such as a free ice cream social and a dinner show with magic and comedy(magicians were great and so was the atmosphere . The food, not so much). I would have loved to stay longer. The hotel has very clean. There were a couple signs that the hotel may have been showing its age a little but nothing that was totally offputting. The staff was able to accomodate an early check an while we waited for our room they allowed us access to all of the facilities. Keys were required for entry into a lot of areas of the hotel wich didn't allow anyone not having one to enter off the beach or entrances through the garage which made my group feel really safe. I had a really nice housekeeper and Michael at the front desk was an exemplary employee. I have never stayed at a hotel that was so close to the ocean,They aren't exaggerating when they say ocean front. I put many hours into planning for trips with the groups that I travel with and I am always a little nevervous about resorts I am not familiar with. This resort was a great value and my family and friends had a great time. I thought it was a little funny when we were checking out there was an employees on a radio reading a long list of people deciding to stay longer. I wish we could have too.

Reviews.Title: “Lower Your Expectations”
Reviews.Author: Jessw222
Reviews.Content: Pros: *We checked in on a Monday and were able to gain early access to our room at 1:30p. *The beach was beautiful and access to it was very easy. (Although no fault of this hotel, it should be mentioned that each day we were there, we were solicited, often by multiple harrassing time share salespeople.) Cons: *The room we stayed in was 1403. Upon arrival we were terribly disappointed to see the roadway directly in front of us rather than the website advertised "eternal views of the beautiful blue ocean and the Inter Coastal Water Way from our top floor sanctuary." This is a highly deceptive statement to advertise. While standing on the balcony and looking to the left you can see the beach and ocean (and the top of the building) but in no way is this what we envisioned. *The balcony did not have, nor could accommodate if they were provided, chairs or an end table. Not what you would expect in a "resort." The room was also an adjoining room and we could hear, quite clearly, noise from the other room, as well as others around us. *The shower pressure in the room was exceptionally weak. I am not sure if it was because the hotel is going for a "green" standard or not but this was terribly unpleasant. *The television is very small for the room, estimated 23" - we could not see it well from our beds. *The indoor pool chemicals were very strong and made use of the pool unbearable. The hot tub was exceptionally hot, almost scalding. Could not use either for longer than a few minutes. *On Wednesday I called the front desk at 7:30am to request the late checkout of 4pm, for a fee which I was aware of was $25. I was on hold for 10 minutes and then was told we could not have this option. When I asked for a checkout of anything later than 11am I was denied that as well. When I asked if there was anything she could offer me the woman said sighed and said in a tone which captured her annoyance with the situation "no - the room has already been reserved we need to clean it." When I asked if she could move the people who have our specific room reserved elsewhere she said flatly "no." I find it hard to believe there was nowhere, on a Wednesday, they could move a reservation to. My impression was that she simply couldn't be bothered. This was not the level of customer service I was anticipating. *So, my family and I, although frustrated, decided to make the best of the situation, since this was our vacation and wanted it to be as stress free as possible. At 8:30am we headed down to the outdoor pool area and to our utter shock found that the majority of the lounge chairs were covered with towels, yet only a dozen or so people were actually AT the pool!! People had left their towels and gone about their business, with total disregard for the people who were there to USE the pool! There was no one there to complain too, not that they would do anything anyway, as we saw signs posted on the doors saying NOT to do this. I did finally find one empty lounge chair which the three of us had to share. UNACCEPTABLE.

Reviews.Title: “Daytona Beach Resort & Convention Ctr.”
Reviews.Author: kevin070478
Reviews.Content: Very nice place. Great value for the money. Owner rented units have a better price. Lots of on site amenities. The beach is great here. Good location for area activities. Will go back for sure. might even buy a unit!! Good place for bikers, they have parking for a trailer.

Reviews.Title: “Strange room; molding cabinets”
Reviews.Author: ocalafergie
Reviews.Content: The lobby was nice. Check in staff friendly and helpful... explained that my room could be accessed from the 4th floor of parking garage so I didn't have to come all the way back down. This was a plus! However, the set up of the room was strange. It was oceanfront suite. You walk in the back of the room from the hall to enter a bedroom. There is an ensuite bath in there. Ok, but sparse and plain. You see a hallway and go down and round a corner and down a long hallway and then you are in the kitchen. Then in front of that is another sitting room with a sofa that folds out into a small bed. (This sofa bed was broken and lopsided and wouldn't even push up against the wall evenly... a mess). The bathrooms were not very clean. A huge dead cockroach was in the hallway (i understand florida bugs, but obviously no one checked the room recently). Then the kitchen, wow, the cabinet doors were moldy. Then someone decided to PAINT OVER THE MOLD. Really? That is crazy, but I did get a photo of that and will try to get it off my camera to post it because that was unbelievable. There were a few hairs on one of the bedspreads so I opted to use the other bed only. It was a big room and had a nice view of ocean, but my sliding door opened up to a shared balcony... anyone could walk right up to my sliding door. This didn't seem safe and was actually creepy when at night you see someone walk right by and hang out for a few minutes looking over the balcony then they keep going. Kids did this alot... playing around the hotel, exploring. My room did NOT look like the photos of the nicer rooms others have posted. So I guess I should have complained, but I arrived later in the day and only stayed one night. If you stay there, ask for a nicer room if you get the one I had.

Reviews.Title: “Daytona Beach Resort is great!”
Reviews.Author: bkbatson
Reviews.Content: Check in was so fast. Elevators were always available. Our room with balcony looked right over the Atlantic and 2 pools, which were a bit cool. Beds were very comfortable with great linens, kitchen fully supplied, 2 burner stove, although no oven, good shower water pressure and bathroom amenities. Our only complaint was that guests put towels on the pool lounges at 7:30am, and the lounges sat empty almost all day long. Luckily we had our own beach chairs and sat on the beach watching the parade of cars/trucks driving by and watching the ocean tides come and go. If you didn't have your own beach chairs, you could rent 2 lounges with an umbrella and table.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay, may return if...”
Reviews.Author: Pamela R
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I booked through expedia and was a tad apprehensive as to what we might get, especially after I called, en route to the hotel with an emergency and needed my doctor to call in a prescription. I asked the hotel representative for the physical address, and or the phone number to the Walgreens directly across the street from the hotel. She was totally unable to provide me with this info. She put me on hold, then I could hear her sarcastically asking someone if they knew the number, then she said she did not have the phone number, I asked did she have a phonebook, she did not. However, upon arrival. To our surprise, we were pleasantly delighted. Mike checked us in and was courteous and professional. Our room was an ocean view, beautiful view. It was clean and the bed was comfortable. We had a kitchenette with a full refrigerator stove top and microwave that was a nice extra. The male bartender was great! pools were very clean. Overall, we had a really great time, however, there were some cons. A large group rented about 3 rooms and kept their doors opened most of the time. They had several kids running in and out the rooms. There were older kids as well playing frisbee in the hall. This group or perhaps another was very loud and noisy, late night. They were screaming and yelling. I called the front desk twice, the last call was at 1:00 am, after I was awaken out of my sleep by several people yelling where they were from. The 2nd night was 100% better. I am not sure if that was because the group(s) left or were spoken to. If they can get a handle on some of the unruly guests and more staff this would be an excellent place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Our suite was our little home on the beach.”
Reviews.Author: TwoBlackCatsInMass
Reviews.Content: We had an ocean front suite. The bed room and kitchen/living area were separate. Very nice when someone wants to sleep and others are awake. The balcony overlooking the ocean is key for any Florida vacation. This private balcony was perfect. It is also easy walking distance from a nice selection of restaurants for the evening. Walgreens and a grocery store are just across Atlantic avenue, so we could stock up our fridge with drinks and snacks. We could enjoy the beach from the balcony, or go down to the pool and ocean. It was really everything I was looking for. We could really enjoy ourselves and just relax.

Reviews.Title: “Bikers Mecka!!! Dream come true”
Reviews.Author: GUNTER11
Reviews.Content: Can't say enof, very happy!!!! From acomadations to the hotel, amenities to the location!!!! Especialy parking covered or front rowe wether we are talking about the bike's or trailer or large passenger van you need it they have it including an indoor pool and bar!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice condo”
Reviews.Author: panzer03
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as part of a race package. Hotel staff were very friendly. Place was clean and beds comfortable. Large pool area. The entire resort is smoke free. Our room had full sized frig, micro wave and 2 burner stove. No oven. There is self parking which is covered. Here you can drive on the beach which is cool.Try the Black Sheep for dinner.

Reviews.Title: “What we found...”
Reviews.Author: Mosania5537
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just came back home after a stay of 15 nights at this hotel. Tripadvisor credits it wit four stars. It has its strong points, that's true: -Rates are reasonable -Good infrastructure: spacious lounge and ground floor, 3 pools, whirlpool, fitness, well equiped studio, balcony overlooking the ocean, right on the beach... -Without asking, we got an upgrade from "riverside" to "oceanfront". -Nice and friendly cleaning persons who were efficient, quick and discrete. -Very good matrass on the bed, important for us. -Quiet hotel, important too. Sorry, but a few minuses: -Such a hotel, calling itself "conference center" doesn't provide an airport shuttle? -Quite unhelpful staff at the reception, or incompetent? One girl even was rather unfriendly, except when we paid our bill checking out. Got the impression she didn't like Europeans. -My wife caught two cockroaches in the bathroom. 4 stars and cockroaches? -Huge hotel, but the only restaurant offers a very poor choice. -The studio had carpet on the floor. It wasn't vacuumed once in the 16 days we were there, and there wasn't a vacuum cleaner available. Is this healthy? At the end, we sneezed a lot. -No entertainment at all. Conclusion: we don't want to complain, we felt good in general while we were there, but the truth has its rights.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, A Great Time”
Reviews.Author: MJCNewYork_NewYork
Reviews.Content: Took a week off and tried the Daytona Beach Resort. It was a blast, the pool side bar and restaurant were great. The rooms were spacious and clean. The only downside was the time of year I was there, Hurricane Irene skirted the coast. I missed a couple days enjoying the beach. It is a great place that I would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased”
Reviews.Author: janfrey
Reviews.Content: We spent from Dec. 30, 2011 - Jan. 1, 2012 at the Daytona Beach Resort and were totally impressed wth the tremendous value the resort provides. The only possible comment would be to have a standing "kids club" or "parents night out". The staff are amazing both at the front desk and at teh Restaurant (Reflections) Rupert especially was tremendous. It would be nice to be able to borrow some beach chairs from the front desk. Room and facilites are superb and the outdoor fireplace is a very nice touch! We had an Ocean Front room with private balcony and love it. Parking is a breeze in the attached tower. We will stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Great beach and strip room for Rod Run”
Reviews.Author: Dixieracing
Reviews.Content: Very good view and location for turkey rod run. Rodeos invade the Publix parking lot across the street at night and this location rules for that.

Reviews.Title: “Severe disappointment.”
Reviews.Author: kttgreen
Reviews.Content: I was led to expect much from this resort and was let down terribly. The cleanliness of the room extends only to linens and carpet. Nearly every surface that could retain a smudge or water mark had many. The full size fridge was fairly clean but the a/c smelled of fairly serious mildew. The staff I found superficially cordial but disinterested in customer satisfaction. Ammenities of the resort are fair but do not commpensate for a curt front desk staff, poor standards of sanitation, and troublesome odor. Your dollars will be spent better elsewhere. Almost anywhere else in fact.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service and help”
Reviews.Author: Derrick H
Reviews.Content: Valerie was amazing she did and expectional job making me feel comfortable. She made sure I was very happy, well-informed, and helped. The job she did was excellent, many of my friends have been there since my recommendation of her- i think she was the manager there if not she definitely deserves to be!!! Thank you Ms. Valerie!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth the High Price”
Reviews.Author: Denise A
Reviews.Content: My husband and my son chose this hotel online due to the great beach location and the activities noted on the site. The hotel is right on Daytona Beach, it has four pools, one indoor, three outdoor, one of which is a kiddie pool with mushroom water feature ( not working). The hotel is a bit on the expensive side especially if you want an ocean view/front. The decor is archaic and in desperate need of a renovation. It looks a bit rundown, the lobby is the best looking part of the whole place. The staff are very friendly and very helpful within the areas they were empowered to help. The parking arrangement was convenient, you can park on the floor that your room was on so this made it very easy with your bags. You did not have to drag everything through the lobby. There is a Publix and some other store across the street, so its very convenient. We got upgraded to a suite, this was wonderful, large room with a living space. The carpet was dingy, and I sneezed the entire time. View was great as well. The pool, deck areas were all run down. It was biketoberfest, when we were there so we checked out early. They were not happy about that and only refunded us one night on a 4 night stay.

Reviews.Title: “DBR drained our account without our authorization”
Reviews.Author: HKing478
Reviews.Content: A few days into our stay we realized that the hotel had taken, without our authorization, almost all our money out of our checking account. You see, when we checked in the employee at the front desk made a mistake and said we could just pay the balance left on our hotel stay when we checked out. The thing is, the account that we paid our $100 deposit with was not the same account that we were going to pay our entire hotel stay with, we had a separate pre-paid card for that. But instead of informing us that they needed the money immediately instead of at check-out, the manager just took the money out of our checking account, which was our spending cash for our vacation. If they simply would have asked us for the money we would have paid the entire amount on the pre-paid card that was designated for our hotel stay. But instead they drained our checking account practically leaving us empty-handed. The worst part is that they didn't even tell us they had taken the money, we had to find out on our own when our card got denied at the store! On top of that, the manager treated us with so much disrespect, as if the entire situation was our fault. I have never stayed at such a despicable hotel in my life with a so-called "hospitality" manager who was fine with ruining someone's vacation and taking their money without so much as telling them they were doing so. It took us 2 full days of our vacation to get our money back and we never even received a simple apology from the hotel. The only enjoyable part of our stay was being far away from the hotel on the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!!”
Reviews.Author: MCarver79
Reviews.Content: Loved this place, great family atmosphere. The staff was very friendly and helpful. RECOMMEND!!!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised!”
Reviews.Author: Sammy I
Reviews.Content: We went to the DBR on a groupon. When I called for the reservation they informed me that their ck. in time was 4:00..which for us would have been a whole day wasted....we paid xtra for a Ocean front room and requested the north tower...(after reading other views on the south tower) We arrived around noon...Lauren was at the front desk....checked us right in! gave us our breakfast passes...ALSO informed us that the tower that had all of the nasty remarks ..are privately own and really have no bearing on the hotel...whew! that was a relief...She and the other gentelman were so nice and answered all of our questions... about the area and restrurants,golf.... The workout area was great,pools for smokers,which we are not and an pool for non smokers...it was just great! I'll go back again!! for sure

Reviews.Title: “Definitely worth a look!”
Reviews.Author: donnag1213
Reviews.Content: Went to DBR this weekend on a Groupon. Very very very pleasantly surprised. Room was amazing, junior suite, ocean front. Restaurant was awesome for breakfast. No issues with "smoking" area at pool. I would DEFINITELY go back.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Resort and Staff!”
Reviews.Author: BruceandCindy
Reviews.Content: Spur of the moment trip for us. Called reservations night before travel and Lois was extremely helpful in assisting with deciding on a room type. It turns out her hometown is where I live. She was so nice. Made the decision to wait and look at the rooms when we arrived. Colton at the front desk was VERY patient with showing us several rooms and finding the perfect view for us. Thank you staff for everything.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: scrapitmom
Reviews.Content: We had a 2 queen w/kitchen on the beach side. It was very nice and quiet. Only complaint were the 3 roaches we found in the tub upon arrival. Not sure how they could get there since everything looked clean unless there is a hole in the drain and they came up that way. Washed them down and closed the drain. Like that there were stores and restaurants right across the street and a short drive to the boardwalk area. Just remember that this time of the year the turtles are laying their eggs so the beach has to be dark at night. I would have liked to sit at the pool bar at night but it had to be closed. The staff was friendly and helpful. Liked the choice of pool or beach and that there were 2 pools. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect”
Reviews.Author: Dantheman1955
Reviews.Content: We booked through a 3rd party and everything went as planned. When our flight got delayed a day we tried to call the hotel. We were informed that we would have to alter our dates through the 3rd party. When they contacted the hotel to alter the date Deborah told we would have to pay for all the nights. I still believe that I was taken for a ride. Once we got to the hotel we had to wait to check in until 4. I thought that was unfair since we had to pay for the night before. We did enjoy our room and the remainder of our stay. The hotel was in a perfect location. My only suggestion would be that The manager Deborah should be a bit more understanding when things happen beyond your control.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but Not Great Vacation - No Frills”
Reviews.Author: Ron M
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I went to the Daytona Beach Resort in late May, which was our first visit to Daytona Beach - Love Florida all together and were looking for a relaxing, beach-sun filled vacation with a little night life peppered in. We rented our room from a private condo owner, so I can't really comment on the Hotel staff type things.... Overall, our vacation was a good B, or 7.5/10. The beach was nice, not crowded (it was late May) and we had a good time. Not much as far as night life - it was really just a beach/pool type vacation. Daytona overall, especially this time of year, is boring. It's not a very nice town and it is full of pretty seedy people. Sort of a Redneck Riviera II.........I would not visit again. Overall, DBR met my expectations. It was nice, clean and provided all the basic amenities that I expected....I wont go back, however, but that is mainly due to Daytona being a crappy place and nothing to do with DBR....I feel that there are much better Florida beach town options (like Saint Augustine!)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Family vacation spot”
Reviews.Author: Sparkiewaltsav
Reviews.Content: We booked our trip with them through Bookit, Got a great rate, We got the suite, it had 2 queen beds in one room and a pull out couch in the living/kitchen area. , you can get a 2 bed room with a small kitchenette with an adjoining door, they door not advertise this you have to ask for it. the room was clean and nice, had a 2 burner stove, full size fridge with ice maker (ice maker has a switch you have to turn on) and a microwave, (no oven :-( , be aware that there is a $12 per day, plus tax, "Resort Fee" that you will have to pay when you get there. It was a perfect location, right on the beach. the pools and spa pools were nice. the indoor pool was a bit cool, but bearable, the outdoor pools were perfect. For some reason they had 1 of the spa pools set at 90 degrees and the other one set at 102 degrees, kinda made the 90 degree spa worthless in my opinion, no one got in it unless they were waiting for others to get out of the hot one, then they would quickly change pools, I can not understand why both spas are not 102-104 degrees which is the normal expected temps for a spa. access to the super clean beach was immediate and easy. we had no problems with jelly fish or stingrays which we have had in the past on the gulf side. the waves were great, one morning they were over 8', great for surfing. the rip tide is fairly strong so you have to watch small children and not go out too far. we went in the middle of September, water temps were great, and crowds were low, best time to go. outside temps were in the mid to high 80s, it did get cool at night, but not cold. the pool side fire was nice spot to warm up after a night swim. the pools are open from 6AM- 11PM. elevators were fast. publix and walgreens and a dollar tree right across the street. we were on the 14th floor (top) on the south side of the building (beach view not ocean front), we opened the curtains every morning to a warm inviting sun, it was very nice. had almost all day sun on the balcony, and a great view of the beach and daytona. they have a live camera on the beach to the right as you go out the gate, your family/friends can access it from their computer and you can go there and wave to them..that was cool..you will love your stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Nice facilities, crappy staff”
Reviews.Author: paxtakor
Reviews.Content: The facilities are very nice with a great ocean view option. It is, however, overpriced and the crooked staff deserves a failing grade. My $300 ipod disappeared from the room into a thin air and was never found. Facilities manager was no use, never even returned a call. Shame, never coming back there!

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: leadman1
Reviews.Content: We've stayed several places in Daytona over the years & this is by far the best.Right on the beach,which we love.It's a couple of miles from the Boardwalk so you're not in quite so much traffic.There are restaurants close by & a grocery store.The resort is spotless & the staff is friendly.Can't go wrong staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Family/Friends Reunion”
Reviews.Author: Renee A
Reviews.Content: Our family and friends have stayed in the Daytona Beach Resort for the past six years and have had wonderful memories!!! This year was exceptional with the "special events" they provided for the kids. They had ice cream sundaes, movie night outside, and karaoke which was great!! My boys are still talking about the movie night and how it was so "cool" to be outside!! Yes, there was one minor problem with the cable at the end of our trip, which the resort was trying to fix, but they were trying their best to make all the guests happy!! All in all... the staff was exceptional and the resort was great!! We look forward to many more years with the Daytona Beach Resort!!

Reviews.Title: “Family Reunion”
Reviews.Author: Myer6937
Reviews.Content: Great rooms, very spacious and comfortable. Wonderful view of the beach and the hotel pools and tiki bar. Beds were comfortable. Housekeeping was terrific and the extra towels were appreciated. The food in the hotel was a presentation. Plates were full and the taste was worth the price. Great time was had by all of us!

Reviews.Title: “Was great till the last few days”
Reviews.Author: livelywoman04
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed 5 of 7 days that were booked. The first 5 days were great! Front desk was great, we had several questions about the area and they helped me out. The resort is fantastic. Much better than the Hilton!!! The last couple of days we dealt with rude staff at the front desk, our cable went out several times, no wifi in the room...we had loud drunks that checked in next to us...called the front desk to complain and was told they couldn't do anything....with the result of checking out a little early. Still a wonderful resort and will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Not too Shabby”
Reviews.Author: jgiaccotto
Reviews.Content: We stayed here between 8/15 - 8/20. The weather and beach were perfect, which made this resort's location a value. It is right on the beach, and it is close to many stores/shops. There were only a few things noted below I would change, but overall it was a good selection. For what we paid, it was a good buy for the product. Room Details: The room was clean and had a lot of space. We had a view of the ocean, and a balcony (small) to place our wet clothes and towels. The biggest plus are the kitchens. They are in great condition, and are definitely a money saver. We were able to walk to Publix accross the street, and buy groceries to save on restaurant costs. Housekeeping: The staff came every day to restock towels and clean up the room. No problems at all. Pool: The pool area was nice. It has two regular pools and a kiddy pool with water fountains. More importantly, there is an outdoor bar/restuarant. The prices were not that bad comparred to other places in the area. You are able to walk right onto the beach from the pool deck which is efficient. Parking: There is a garage attached to the hotel which is easy access to the rooms. Downsides: The internet never worked in our room. There is a 12/day resort fee that should include wireless, however it never seemed to work besides in the AM (before 8 am). Besides that, the water pressure in the shower was low at times. Overall Rating: 8 out of 10

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, nice pool, bar, and spa but a lot of tourists”
Reviews.Author: sarah407
Reviews.Content: This place was nice. Two outside pools, one kiddie pool, two indoor hot tubs, an indoor pool. All right on the beach. Almost every room has a view of the beach. Beautiful! The people at the front desk were very nice too! The only things we didn't like were that when we turned off the AC in the room and then turned it back on, there was a weird smell, like musty. Plus a lot of tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Our #1 Summer Beach Vacation!”
Reviews.Author: Lee M
Reviews.Content: We have been spending our summer vacation at DBR for the past three years. We really enjoy how clean and well maintain the resort is. The staff are friendly and ready to solve any problems we may have. The location is another reason we like staying at DBR. The grocery store and pharmacy are a short walking distance from the resort. I would like to include that I feel safe and secure at DBR which helps for a worry free vacation. We can hardly wait until next year for our return stay.

Reviews.Title: “We Love it everytime”
Reviews.Author: Mallisa S
Reviews.Content: When in Daytona, I highly recommend Daytona Beach Resort and Conference Center. As you walk in the fabulous lobby, you will be greeted by a team of professional and pleasant staff, Especially Michael Infante. If you need anything Michael will be at your service to make sure your stay is a most memorable one. I have visited this hotel over 6 times, and numerous times coming. The rooms, the food , the drinks, the pools all worth going back for. But we all know it's about customer service, Well, you cannot get any better than the service from Michael Infante. Keep up the GREAT Job Michael !! MS.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, superb guest services and amenities, spotless all around, smells great !!!”
Reviews.Author: izzy082
Reviews.Content: sales people are very knowledgeable and friendly, guest services extremely courteous at anytime. Rooms and suites are very spacious. Resort is always clean and shiney and above all.. always smells great!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loud, loud, loud!”
Reviews.Author: justpassingthrough64
Reviews.Content: We use a travel club, and stayed at the DBR in the Club-managed condo. Since DBR doesn't maintain the room, won't comment beyond saying that it must be in the older part of the hotel - old carpet, musty smell, etc. The amenities are nice. We had booked two weeks, and while we didn't find the resort to be anything special had no real problems until Saturday night, when we and our three small children were kept awake until midnight by loud, pounding music. So sorry, nothing to be done, a wedding party has booked the space. Many apologies from the day manager the next morning. So, Sunday was pretty much a waste as we all napped all day to recover from our late night. Sunday night, we arrived back from visiting family only to find the windows in our room vibrating - according to the front desk, a "band" was doing a sound check for a concert to be held Monday evening. Again, sorry, but they paid for the space. Well, so did we, and we expect to be able to sleep in our hotel room! Oh, yes, they'll be gone by 10:00 pm (or 11:30) but they'll be back tomorrow for the concert. Well, I can't speak to what happened Monday night because our vacation club moved us to a smaller, quieter, more family friendly hotel. DBR's staff were all very polite and apologetic, but unable to turn down the volume. So if late nights are for you, so is DBR. But if you want to sleep, you may want to look around a bit more.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it”
Reviews.Author: slugabed
Reviews.Content: We had a condo rented by owner. It was cheaper than what we would have paid if we rented from the hotel. The staff was very helpful and nice. The room was big and clean and had a small balcony where you can enjoy the view of the ocean. The beach was clean and the sand was wonderfully soft. We used the swimming pool and enjoyed it. You cannot go mych better than this for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing views, amazing service!”
Reviews.Author: RayzWife
Reviews.Content: Wonderful stay. 5 nights in an ocean front room with private balcony. Booked through hotwire, not knowing where we'd be staying until all was paid for. $80 a night! Originally was booked into river view room, but spoke with Michael, the front desk manager. In person. Told him it was a special occasion and could he upgrade us? Sometimes ya just gotta ask! He was so amazing and put us in the ocean front with no extra charge!! We like Mike! Room was great! Big king bed, full size fridge, also microwave and flat top two burner stove. Pots, dishes, utensils and automatic ice-maker in freezer made for a great stay. My only negative is under the shelf lip of the tub needs to be cleaned better. We were in room 548 which is on the 5th floor with big private balcony overlooking one of 4 pools, the ocean, the nightly firepit. Just breathtaking! Got a couples massage at the spa first night! Best massage ever!!!!! Do it!!! Thanks to all the staff! Ps. Parking garage attached to resort allowed super convenient entry to our floor at all times and it was free!! Free wi-fi was pretty good, though spotty on occasion. Overall....A+!!

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back”
Reviews.Author: carp0045
Reviews.Content: Very nice conviently located professional staff clean rooms

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly suprised!”
Reviews.Author: GizmoFamilyofthree
Reviews.Content: Pleasantly suprised! The staff was friendly, the rooms were cleaned daily, all 4 pools were great, beach towels were supplied, beach was gorgeous. My ONLY complaint, we stayed oceanview and they advertised having a balcony. It did have a balcony but it was only about 15 inches deep (standing room only). Otherwise, it was perfect!

Reviews.Title: “A Renewed Delight”
Reviews.Author: relaxed2011-1
Reviews.Content: This was a weekend that renewed our 30 year relationship as well as our minds. DBR was one of the best resorts we have stayed in--in a long time. The reservation line and front desk personal was friendly which made check-in an awesome beginning to a great weekend. It was great to see a GM (Micheal) engage with guest as well as his team. I must admit that the best thing however was our room that came with a ocean view balcony and very comfortable bedding. The full frig and 2 eye stove gave us the home feeling though there were more than enough economical restaurants within walking distance. Our minds are already made-up that this weekend hide-out will see us quarterly.

Reviews.Title: “Can't get enough of the DBR”
Reviews.Author: gatorwnek
Reviews.Content: We had another awesome stay. From the beginning, Michael Infante took excellent care of our reservation and ensured that the accommodations were to our satisfaction. The ocean front view was amazing; it was like living on the beach. Using the kitchenette for breakfast and dinner provided us more quality family time. We loved hanging out together on the balcony admiring the perfect ocean view. The staff and guests were all friendly. The beach and pool were so relaxing. Our kids loved playing in the surf and riding their boogie boards(so did the adults...glad they were willing to share). This was our fifth year in a row and we can't wait to get back.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Room? Or Beach Amenities?”
Reviews.Author: Flmum
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself has a lot to offer and is very nice as far as that is concerned. But your trading cleanliness in your room for it. The room was Oceanside with a spectacular view, but when you walked in mold was on the wall. The floor had dirt all over and hadn't been vacuumed. The bathroom was so nasty we didn't shower over our two day stay. The shower curtain was covered in mold, the tub and floor was also. The bathtub also had hair in it. Nasty. The ac while super cold was dirty and hadn't obviously been cleaned in a long while. Also illegally this hotel doesn't mention there resort fees. They charge $12 per night with tax for a whopping $13.50 per night. They also put a $100 hold on your credit card that they give back 5 days after your stay for a security deposit. Which no one told me about - ahem Michael! We paid for wifi but didn't get it in our room only poolside and in the lobby. If you want fun and amenities this is the place if you want clean and honest----- look elsewhere!!!!

Reviews.Title: “ok daytona not what it used to be”
Reviews.Author: twbfilm89
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 night Saturday thru Thursday. The room was ok. The resort fee was high. The biggest problem was the non-smoking resort. I did not read anything and the web site about a non- smoking in the resort. I have no problem with a smoke free rooms but having to hide in the parking lots was a little ridicules. Over all we had a nice stay. Dayton beach has seen better days. I don’t think I will go back to Dayton.

Reviews.Title: “Dad / Husband's personal opinion”
Reviews.Author: aggieak
Reviews.Content: After reading countless reviews from this hotel and many others, I decided on this one, and after being there for 3 nights, I nailed it. Wife really enjoyed the room, and so did our kids. We had an oceanfront room to appease the wife/kids. Besides the standard nice staff, clean rooms, blah blah blah, here are the pluses: I really liked that the room was long and had 2 TVs (one for the wife and I, and one for the kids). Athough we didnt use it, the room came with a mini kitchen, stove, frig, microwave, with pots, utensils, glasses. Another plus is that our room was close to the parking deck, which is attached to the hotel, so that I didnt have to drag everything through the main hotel lobby, elevator, etc. All I did was park on the same level as my room, and unpacked from there. I agree with the other comments, in that the parking deck is somewhat tight. We had a midsize car and we were ok. Anyone that has a huge SUV would say differently. Another plus is that there are 2 outside pools, and in addition a kiddie pool, so it was not overcrowded. I liked the fact that one end was 8ft deep so that my wife and I could enjoy it more.
