My kids were on the other end 3ft enjoying themselves. We enjoyed the inside pool too (water is a lot warmer). Another plus was that there was always something going on at the hotel over the weekend. There was a DJ outside playing music, the hotel had grilled hamburgers, hotdogs, chicken, for a small fee.....great atmosphere. We didnt use it, but they offered a 'parents night out' as well. There were other amenities, like the restaurants, spa, tiki bar, fire pit at night, fitness center, etc, but we did not use them. One more tip is that we enjoyed the waterpark which is about a 5 min drive. A couple of negatives: The walls in the room are kinda thin, and I could hear the people in the room next to mine during the morning we were trying to sleep in. The pillows and blankets were somewhat worn Those negatives are minor in comparison to the overall stay, to which I will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: maggie1691
Reviews.Content: We would stay again. We loved the view of ocean front room and the staff are wonderful especially Michael, he make sure everybody is being help but at the same time he didn't rush or pushing you out of the way to get to the next customer. My family enjoyed the stayed!! Thank you for all your help Michael,

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and have gone twice and will be back again!”
Reviews.Author: asmith123
Reviews.Content: We have stayed there 2 times, this year in June and also last year in July. Both times were great with no issues. The rooms are very nice and clean and spacious. We loved the kitchens in them for cooking breakfast and lunch as well. We loved all the pools, the gym, and the overall experience. One of the nicest hotels in Daytona in my opinion. A bunch of restaurants both within walking distance or driving distance. There are also places to eat within the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Comprehensive”
Reviews.Author: kymoodyman
Reviews.Content: I spent four days at the Daytona Beach Resort and Conference Center. The room was very nice and included a microwave, stove, sink, and refrigerator. The beds were firm. The resort has two outdoor and one indoor pool and two hot tubs. And the property is located on the beach. The staff was friendly and attentive although it was very busy with several functions going on -- two weddings and one reunion.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: dutchtreatOrlando
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a three day "romantic" weekend, this sums it up. Facts: Requested ocean front with bacony. Got ocean view with a mini balcony that we could only stand on. Front desk people were rude. They charged additional "resort fees", which was supposed to include wifi. The wifi did not work. The cable reception Was pure snow. In addition to not having room service, the restaurant and bar were closed Both Friday and Saturday for "private parties" Had to leave the "resort" for meals. Their website shows beach chairs and umbrellas on the beach, insinuating they are available for hotel guest use. They are not. In fact they are rented by a private vendor who charges $30.00 per day, rain or shine. We rented but the weather quickly changed after only two hours, when beach patrol said they had to leave the beach. The rooms are old, another poster said 1980's Miami Vice, that is true. The elevators broke down twice during our stay, the walls are thin as paper, and the entire staff has an I don't give a crap attitude. I really can't believe any one would give this hotel a good rating, especially for the money, and the "hidden" charges they sock you with. There is NO room service, in fact even worse,

Reviews.Title: “LOVED LOVED this place!”
Reviews.Author: ohsweetpea
Reviews.Content: Loved the pools, loved the Unit! We stayed in a corner unit and it was immaculate! This place was perfect. I have absolutely no complaints. Would definitely stay here again and even considering purchasing a unit!

Reviews.Title: “This is definitly the best place on Daytona Beach!”
Reviews.Author: EgyptB0und
Reviews.Content: The hotel value was great and the staff very helpful and friendly, especially Allie at the front desk. The restaurant was very good and not expensive. Also, the drinks at the bar were poured very generously which is always not the case in resorts like these. Daytona beach has a lot of dingy places and you have to be careful where you book. This place is clean, reasonably priced and great location right on the beach!

Reviews.Title: “Best value in Daytona”
Reviews.Author: PantherHospitality
Reviews.Content: This ocean front hotel will surprise you with four pools, great rooms and the best staff in Daytona. The front desk team will blow you away with service and kindness... Be sure to try the pool bar for cool drinks or a glass of wine at the fire pit for a great time!

Reviews.Title: “All my stays have been wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: SHASHASunnyFlorida
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure where a few of these reviewers stayed because I have never had an issue or been disappointed with the service or accommodations in all the 8 times I have visited Daytona Beach Resort. This last time, I had booked a oceanfront standard (normally do the oceanfront suite) when we got to the room, the floor was soaked just inside the door. They immediately upgraded and moved us to the oceanfront suite. There was a Republican convention and a wedding there during our stay..we didn't hear a thing except the wonderful cello playing out by the pool for entertainment. We have always experienced awesome service by staff. This is a wonderful place to stay with 3 pools, an outdoor bar for refreshment, showers to rinse off after coming off the beach, an indoor pool and hot tubs. It is convenient (across the street) to a grocery store, dollar tree, sub shop, frozen yogurt shop, Walgreen, Ruby Tuesday, surf shops and department store. It is far enough away from the craziness that can be Daytona. We love it, my teenage kids love it..just WONDERFUL! Take it from a mom who wants her moneys worth...this is the place!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Terrible”
Reviews.Author: chelberg
Reviews.Content: On a scale of one to ten I would give this hotel a negative five. The service is absolutely terrible, from the moment we checked in we knew we were going to regret staying there. For starters the front desk attendant was extremely rude. We pre-booked our room through bookit.com and had chosen "resorts choice" but requested an ocean view. The lady rudely informed us that we had not paid for an ocean front room so we were not getting one unless we wanted to add an additional twenty dollars a night to the amount we already paid. She then proceeded to inform us that we had to pay an additional twelve dollars a night anyways for amenities (whether we were using them or not) which in the end ended up being more than the twelve a night because they still tax that amount. The next day we went to Reflections, their restaurant, for breakfast. We were the only two people in the restaurant, we waited forty-five minutes for our food to find out that our server forgot to put in our order. She comped our meal (which was probably the nicest thing that happened there). We arrived again for breakfast the next morning and the same thing happened. We spoke to the hotel manager who assured us he would direct the issue and have his GM contact us. We did not see or hear from him again until we ran in to him during check out. They could not even check us out properly, we asked for room charges on one credit card and hotel ammenity charges on the other. They assured us they did so but when we got home to check our account everything was put on one card and the security deposit still had not been returned. On top of that towels are not easy to get, you have to sign them out then return them back by that night or you get charged for them. (so much for being a "Green" resort!) The staff in each department was very unfriendly and unhappy to be there. One of the bartenders at the pool bar was not even carding people who were clearly underage. We were super excited for a nice weekend get away, arriving at this hotel did not allow for that. I would not recommend staying here unless it is the absolute last resort. No matter how good the price is it's not worth and you end up paying a lot more in the end anyways.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Great Price from Expedia”
Reviews.Author: Dejais
Reviews.Content: I needed a place for an overnight stay with my mother in the Daytona area when we were visiting family. Since we were only spending the night and leaving early the next morning, I took Expedia up on their $79. deal they offered. It allowed you to book a 3.5 star hotel in Daytona Beach without revealing the hotel until after you booked (much like Priceline). This was the first time I had ever tried this and I have to say, we were pretty pleased. The room was oceanfront and had a kitchen in it. Had we been able to stay longer, the oceanfront would have been ideal. There were two pools below us and an indoor pool as well. Our only complaint was we had to pay for parking which I think is gouging. I mean, where else would you park? And the beds were not that comfortable and a bit musty smelling. But for our purpose and the price, the place was decent.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Good time for race week.”
Reviews.Author: KimBarnes27
Reviews.Content: Great location. Close to shopping center (right accross the street) with grocery, drugstore and more. Close to food places. Nice beach access. Rooms were nice and clean. We did have a few issues, one being a closet door broken. Small stovetop but we didn't use it. Full size frigerator. Balcony was nice but not private. You need to watch, in the older part balconies just have a half wall between so you can shake hands with your neighbor. We didn't mind though we really didn't see anyone out much with it being race weekend. Pool area very nice. Easy beach access but you need your key to get back in. I would definately stay again. If the price is right I would stay during race week again.

Reviews.Title: “Be very cautious if you decide to stay here”
Reviews.Author: WisconsinTiger
Reviews.Content: Not a good start to my five-day stay. First off - when I booked the room I requested a one bedroom suite - when I made the reservation I told the reservation person over and over I need not the jr suite - I need a one bedroom suite. When I arrived and walked into my room - there it was - a jr. king suite. The gentleman at the front desk tried to find me a one-bedroom - but to no avail. There was none available for the five days. The manager called and said "so sorry" you should have looked at your email confirmation closer - it read jr king suite. Thank you very much!!! We also noticed when we walked into the room - it smelled like an ash tray - their response "this is a non smoking hotel" A maintenance man came in and sprayed the room - lasted for one day. Thank you very much!! If you do decide to stay here - they make you sign for towels- which we did. We try to be "green" so we used the same towels for three days. When I took the towels back and asked for new ones she said "you were suppose to bring them back on the same day you took them out". She made me sign for new towels - I asked her to make sure we wouldn't be charged for the towels and her response was "I will see what I can do" . Thank you very much!! Just another thing to worry about. - Not what I need on vacation. When we left we recieved our bill which showed the correct amount. When I got home to make sure the charge was correct - the bill showed $100 more than what was on my receipt. I called to find out what was going on - the girl informed me that they add $100 to make sure it clears? and we should get $100 back on our card within three to five days. Never heard of it?! She said we should have been informed of that when we checked in. - Thank you very much!!! By the way - when you book a room and they say there will be approximately $12.00 resort and taxes fee. In reality - they charge $12.00 for resort fee. There are additional taxes at the end.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, good location and beautiful beach”
Reviews.Author: BJD1950
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 days before moving over to a motel closer to the track for the Daytona 500. Beautiful hotel, rooms are large, great views of the oceanfront (get a room with a balcony). Our room was a king suite, which had a small kitchen, full size refrigator, small living area that included loveseat and chair overlooking the ocean. We were able to bring "left overs" from eating out and put the in the fridge, as well as eat sandwiches for lunch, since we had plenty of storage/dishes. My only compliant with the hotel was the house keeping staff. They basically made the beds daily, gave you new linens and put 2 bottles of water in the fridge. One day I had to call housekeeping to get the room serviced..........This was at 2:45 p.m. When I called the houseeeping number somone answered with a "hello". VERY UNPROFESSIONAL. I asked if I had reach housekeeping he said yea. I said I needed the room serviced he said ok, not even asking what room I was in. I then called back about 30 minutes later, spoke with another man and a few minutes later a man and woman came and again hurriedly made the bed and left clean towels. I had to request housekeeping to vaccum the room and change the bed linens after the third day. You can walk to several good resturants from the hotel and there is a Publix grocery store and Bealls for shopping. Upon check out I let the man at the desk know how displeased I was with the housekeeping staff. He said he knew they were lacking in that department. We will definitely stay here again whe visiting Daytona Beach.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, but really really THIN walls!”
Reviews.Author: RaizeProf
Reviews.Content: Really nice hotel, great location and great staff but the hotel walls are so thin that you feel you are sharing a room with your neighbors! I would not stay here again for this reason alone! Wish they insulated the walls! Not restful!

Reviews.Title: “Dont stay here”
Reviews.Author: atrialescape
Reviews.Content: This is a horrible hotel.Find somewhere else to stay.The staff is terrible the restaurant is overpriced and they charge you for amenities whether you plan to use them or not.Who wants to use a weight room on vacation.I emplore you do not stay here you will regret it.Make this a last resort hotel only if nothing else is available.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: lcf0106
Reviews.Content: Even though this hotel could use a renovation- it's decor reminded me of the mid 80's and Miami Vice, the place was immaculate! Our room was spotless as was the rest of the hotel. I always get nervous staying at a non- chain hotel, but this was well worth it! My only negative comment would be that the onsite rest. was never busy and had no ambiance- looked like some chairs and tables in an empty room. Would have been more of a disappointment for breakfast had there not been a Denny's right across the street. But really, don't hesitate staying here!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: ADKS1998
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 days it was great , room was nice and clean we had a oceanfront suite. Only thing is the kitchen area and the bathroom were smaller, then the Ocean view suite. So, i would recommend this hotel to anyone, right across from a shopping plaza, 2 indoor hot tubs, indoor pool, outside 1 heated pool, kiddie, and reg. pool. This will be our choice every time we come to Daytona Beach. Thanks everyone!!!

Reviews.Title: “good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: dakgrl
Reviews.Content: great location -quieter area of daytona but close to stores, restaraunts, directly ON the beach, 4 pools- so were never too crowded. full kitchen in room-full size refrigerator.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: adventurelady99
Reviews.Content: Decent location on beach near the shopping mall and restaurant area. Was once a grand hotel left to become run down and then fairly recently renovated but that reno seemed to be a quick job. Beds, linens ect are very fresh and comfortable, but paint was just slapped on very rough walls and was already seriously peeling off the bathroom door : the balcony door would barely close let alone lock. The desk staff were not too enthusiastic, but not unpleasant. The bell boys seemed to be working hard though. There is a spa , a pool (more peeling paint) and a mini mart to service the microwave/fridge set up in rooms. Pretty lobby, but like the inside dining room, very very dark. I should have stayed at the near by Hilton - it looked pretty up scale in comparison

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel- really slow staff”
Reviews.Author: OkieinFlorida
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel in July for the 4th and for the Coca-Cola Zero 400. The first 2 nights we stayed in the standard room. I booked two doubles on the hotel's Web site, they gave me a room with a king size bed and a pull-out couch. We were mainly going to be in the room just to sleep, so we didn't care that much. We did, however, call down to the front desk and ask for sheets and blankets for the pull-out couch, they never came. Ever. Luckily there was an extra blanket on the king bed, so we used that. The last night we were there, we switched over to one of suites on the other side of the building. The room was really nice. I say it's definitely worth the money to upgrade. The bed was a lot more comfortable, too. The bathroom was huge and the private balcony was awesome. Once again, though. The pull-out couch in the living room didn't have sheets or blankets, and no extras in the room anywhere. So around 3 p.m. on Sunday, when we were in the room, we called and asked them to bring some up. They said someone was on their way. We waited for about 45 minutes and called again. They said they would have someone up there, so we told them we'd be at the pool and just to have them put it in our room. We get back to the room around 7. Still no sheets. We call again- they said nobody had called them from our room today so they had no idea. (whatever). So they say someone is coming with them. We're in our room until 9 o'clock- still nothing came. We go to the front desk before we go to dinner and watch the fireworks... they said someone will personally bring them to our room while we're gone. We get back around 1 a.m. NO SHEETS/BLANKETS! We call down there, pissed, demand sheets and blankets. Finally 15 minutes later, a security guard brought them to our room. So the reviews are correct when they say you have to pretty much take care of yourself at this hotel. BUT the staff was extremely friendly, even if they can't accommodate their guests. Also, don't waste your money at the drinks at the pool. Mix your own drinks in your room and take them with you. It was $7.00 for one of those really small plastic cups for a drink that barely had any alcohol in it. The location was good for what we wanted, but far from restaurants and the board walk. All in all, we didn't let the "bedding experience" ruin our trip. Just a minor glitch. Just be prepared not to get anything you ask for. :)

Reviews.Title: “A good value at an excellenct location.”
Reviews.Author: 1985dawg
Reviews.Content: The Daytona Beach Resort and Conference Center is definitely an above-average hotel. Byron, at the front desk, was very helpful in assisting my wife and myself as we decided which type of room we selected. As for the maid service, other than making the bed, I'm not really sure what they did, if anything. We booked online for a very low rate ($67) but would have been very unhappy if we had been forced to stay in the room. We paid the difference ($20) to move to an ocean-view room which was much, much nicer. It seems that there are two very different sides of the hotel. The lower 5-story side seemed older and the rooms were much smaller (think 12x25 Days Inn motel room). The 14-story "Tower" where we ended up staying seems much newer with more spacious, generally much nicer, rooms. There is a $13 per day "Resort Fee" which I hate, but did know about in advance. So far as I can tell, it pays for parking, a local paper and wifi. Why not just include that in the price of the room? Overall, 100 bucks a night for a large ocean-view room in a fairly nice, clean resort is a pretty good deal.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic resort, great staff, very very clean!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: dallasj
Reviews.Content: well after the oil spill ruined our plans to go to panama city, we were scrambling trying to find a different destination as being we went to myrtle beach last year, so armed with a month to work with we settled on daytona..a lot of the places were booked and there didnt seem to be a lot of nicer ones available, and traveling with 3 adults, and 3 kids 6, 11, 14..took a little bit of work, after picking the DBR, i couldnt find many pictures of the rooms or the floor plans on their website nor trip advisor, and after reading some of the reviews i had mixed feelings, but we found a oceanfront suite with 2 queen beds and a queen sleeper sofa and a kitchenette, we got a great rate for 6 days, upon reading reviews i read that there was an additional resort fee from 12-15 a day, so that was no problem, also there is a 100$ deposit which i read already so it was no problem as well, i recommend paying it in cash so you can get it back as soon as you check out, but overall it was a very nice place they had 4 pools 1 of which was indoors two hot tubs, the bar out side was great with reasonable prices, the restaurant had decent food and prices were again reasonable, the parking garage is one of the best things the acess door to the hotel was right by our room door so unloading and loading was super easy, and your car being cool when you got in was priceless, the places was clean they ad staff painting the halls testing sprinklers, you can see that they take great care of this property, i took a lot of pictures that i am posting to give folks what it looks like, and it was absolutely wonderful, not sure if i will go back to daytona with the limited attractions and things to do there, but if i do i can bet you where ill be staying...DBR

Reviews.Title: “It was "OK"”
Reviews.Author: lovethebeach00
Reviews.Content: Deceptive Marketing is my biggest complaint! We booked the room on Expedia (103/night) only to find when we get there, it's really $115/night with $12/day "Resort Fees". Humm, first time I 've heard that one (use to be phone deposits etc). Then you were told you would get a $50 gift card to spend on the "resort". "Oh no maam', that is only if you did not take the 'discount for the room, And, I am sure you did" he said. Uhh...well yea but the internet ad did not share that part with you. We get to the room, It was hot and muggy,I go to turn the Air on high and it shut off. I went to call the front desk and the phone was dead. Hummm, I thought well maybe they will move us to a room with an actual "balcony" with more than standing room. It was actually more of a 'stoop' half being taken up by the air conditioner unit that did not work! But, no such luck the maintaniance man fixed the air and the phone. We were stuck with the 'stoop' to view the parking lot and a piece of the beach. The book in the room says "Room Service". So we call down for lunch only to find out after the order that you have to go down to the bar and pick it up. My response was "but the book says room service", She says "well, you can call from the ROOM to order it"! I was told it was $25.00 a DAY for two chairs/umbrealla, to find out that price was only good if you pay for 7 days or more. Got a menu slid under the door from Pizza place across the street "free delievery " finally..room service. 20 mins later, I get a phone call " I am in the lobby, come and get it" haha:) No such thing as room service here and it does not deserve the name resort. So they have an overpriced day spa in the lobby...big deal! Thank God I had my buddies and didn't let all this bother me, but would not stay again. One good thing ...the staff was very friendly..."scripted", but friendly none the less.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I've ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: ZakiyaL86
Reviews.Content: My companion and I spent a brief 2 days in daytona after a long expansive vacation that took us from Seattle to las Vegas to Atlanta to Orlando and finally Daytona. When we initially arrived we didn't know where we would stay after seeing all of the worst hotels the beach had to offer it was a relief to arrive at the daytona beach resort. It was clean and a nice modern setup we were sold. The hotel wasn't cheap by any means we spent 300 dollars for two nights and had an extra 100 dollars held for a deposit. The staff were helpful and the bell hop brought us to our room giving us a nice tour of the compound. As we made our way towards our room I was somewhat confused. The hotel tenants seemed somewhat shady and the cleaning staff seemed very blasé. Our room was a studio which was very compact. We enjoyed the facilities pool and and ordered in the first night. The second day we wanted to stay on the beach the entire day we really enjoyed ourselves and when I returned to my room to take my daily medication for my chronic asthma I noticed that our room hadn't been serviced none of the trash receptacals were emptied and the bed wasn't made; but the towels were replenished. After further inspection I realized my medications were all gone at a cost of nearly 200 dollars. We cleaned the room ourselves and searched high and low before we approached the staff mike the manager could only tell me this has never happened before and couldn't I go replace them. After talking to the general manager mike determined it was necessary to file a police report and file a claim with the hotels insurance company. They never offered to comp us anything towards our stay or offered us any restitution. They continued to question me rather than staff even implying at one point that this may have happened to me before. I was incredibly disappointed in the lack of concern for my health this wasn't a watch or a few dollars or camera this was my wellbeing. We checked out first thing in the morning and I'm currently waiting for the general manager to call me. Finally I just wanted to mention to any person of color that the racial tension could be cut with a knife. A woman yelled at her son to get out of the hot tub now even when she was getting ready to get in herself as soon as my boyfriend and I approached the hot tub to get in. I also had a older white male tell me I was beautiful for a colored girl (WTF). Ratio was 95:5

Reviews.Title: “Home away from Home!”
Reviews.Author: jenant1225
Reviews.Content: My family and I are locals. We reside in Ormond Beach, FL. Unfortunately due to the economy we could not afford our usual summer vacation. So instead we decided to have a mini vacation here in town. Let's just say, we felt as if we were really on vacation. Not only was the room comfortable. But the service provided to us was AWESOME!!! Everyone was very professional and very prompt. Especially a bellman named Tim. Unfortunately my husband was not with me at the time of check in, so I had to unload everything on my own with 3 small childern. Seeing me struggle in the parking garage with many many bags, a playpen and a huge suitcase Tim insisted on helping without me even asking and me telling me I could do it. (I guess its a pride thing) He kept insisting. Honestly, I dont think I could have done it without his help. He went over and beyond his job duty to make sure we got settled in properly. Ans at that moment I knew it was oing to be a good stay at the resort. If someone reads this that works at the resort please give him recognition for he is a very good employee. Overall, this was the best mini vacation I have ever taken. And my kids had the best time ever. I would definately stay at the Daytona Beach Resort again in the future... Thnak you again to the resort and staff for the wonderful stay..

Reviews.Title: “Your Get Your $$'s worth!”
Reviews.Author: Amelia C
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Daytona Beach Resort with my boyfriend and 2 boys 9 and 11. While it was in the middle of winter, it was pretty nice out for us "new jersey folk" who were coming from VERY cold temperaturese. The location was absolutley SPECTACULAR and literally ON the beach! Nice place - clean. However, some of the staff were not too friendly and not too eager to please. Overall though, nice time.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the money”
Reviews.Author: jbbozeman01
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay online, which is the way to go since it is significantly less expensive that way. We arrived at 1:30, and even though check-in is not until 4pm, we were able to get in our room since we booked the "resort's choice." We had an ocean-view room and the resort has a covered garage, which was nice- no hot car to get into. Location is great because it is almost at Ormond Beach, so you are away from all the rowdy, crowds in the heart of Daytona's strip. Everywhere the man at the front desk suggested for dinner turned out to be great! Wish we would have asked the first night. For the money you pay, the rooms are fine. It is no 5-star hotel, but if that is what you want, you will have to pay much ore than the price at this resort. Our only negative is that the wireless Internet did not work in our room. We had to go to the lobby area to check our email, but that was no big deal, since there are comfortable sofas in the lobby. W don't spend a lot of time on computer at beach anyway. There is a $15 a day resort fee, but we knew about this beforehand, and the price was still good, including this fee.

Reviews.Title: “WANT TO GO BACK!!!!”
Reviews.Author: prusky62
Reviews.Content: This place was awesome! Very clean, nice staff! Enjoyed the ocean front view! Stayed 5 days! Booked room a couple months in advance and got a great deal! Stayed an extra day in Daytona, but decided to check out other beachfront hotels. Stayed at Hilton, very disappointed. Wished I had just stayed at Daytona Beach Resort. Checked out about 5 other places too, none of them satisfied me after leaving this place. Already planning another trip!!

Reviews.Title: “Love it, Love it, Looooove it”
Reviews.Author: tolasi
Reviews.Content: We arrived late (10pm) on a weekday. Never before visiting the area we were suprised that Daytona Speedway is right on the main road, kinda cool for Nascar fans. It was fun driving down the main drag and seeing many shops lit up and many visitors still out and enjoying themselves. When we arrived at the hotel we walked into a very nice lobby and checked into our room with a friendly staff.. They have a parking garage - this was a bit of a concern for us because our vehicle is a bit larger than most (Hummer H2)and it barely fit, but we managed. We unloaded our things and found our room. We opened the door to find 2 queen size beds (real queens, not full/queen) then a bathroom/ vanity area. There was a door that was able to shut off the bedroom part and then the living room/ kitchen area. And dont forget the wonderful balcony overlooking the pools and beach! I was very pleased with our entire stay. We had alot of fun. The room was plenty large enough for 5, 3 being teenagers. We really enjoyed our stay. My grandparents who had their own room had the identical room as we did. They come to Daytona every year for bikeweek and biketober fest and they have stayed at many, many hotels in the area and they also really liked this hotel. I would highly recommend this to anyone!!

Reviews.Title: “Save yourself a serious headache and skip this!”
Reviews.Author: PuggyMama
Reviews.Content: I spent three days here for a work trip last week, I shouldv'e known from the shadiness of the per day charge mentioned here that something was up. The second day the housekeeping staff failed to replace toilet paper in room, when I called front desk I was told I could come pick it up myself if I so desired. This is a minor issue but was still an annoyance to me as it should've been sent up by desk staff. The major problem was when I returned home and found out not only was my employer charged for the room, I was ALSO charged for the room, and at a higher rate than quoted. When I called to complain I was first told I would have to call back when I refused I was treated to a series of rude and unhelpful staff who insisted I was wrong, we are still fighting with hotel to resolve the double charges.

Reviews.Title: “Location and Luxury rolled into one.”
Reviews.Author: hblaly
Reviews.Content: Spent a wonderful week in a very comfortable and clean ocean front room. At night the ocean would lull me to sleep. The resort staff and facilities are top notch and I highly recommend getting a facial at the Spa.

Reviews.Title: “Decent place to stay....I would return.”
Reviews.Author: erin_murphy988
Reviews.Content: I just returned from this "resort" after a week long stay. We booked on priceline and requested a room with 2 beds because there was 4 of us traveling....however, when we got there "all they had" was a room with 1 king bed. We stated that we needed 2 queens....but they put us in the King room anyway with a puny pull out sofa. We were told the reason why they couldn't grant our request was because there was a "very large wedding group" arriving there for the week. Okay...this was true...there WAS a wedding...but large? Not so much. Most of the guests were in and out in 1 day....after Sunday (the wedding was Saturday), the parking lot and deck was practically empty and there was no sign of a wedding group there anymore. That was really the only mishap we had with the staff. They were very nice to accommodate us if we needed something (extra linens, towels, etc.) and there was plenty to do around the resort. I wish we could have gotten the chance to try the resort restaurant. The hotel was about a 5 minute drive into "downtown" Daytona near the Ocean Walk which was nice. We weren't in the middle of all the activity so we could sleep at night yet it was just around the corner if need be. We took a day trip up to St. Augustine and it was beautiful! I recommend that! Overall, a great stay. I also enjoyed the small kitchen that was in the room. No oven, but there was a stove top and full fridge/microwave. The internet and parking were included in the $13/day resort fee. So, technically, they aren't free.

Reviews.Title: “Ready to go back!”
Reviews.Author: Ash237
Reviews.Content: They have great front desk and customer service. they upgraded us to an ocean view room wich was basically like ocean front. Soem balconies are small but you can stand on it and look out at the ocean. Room was great bed was comfy and so was sofa bed. Huge bathroom. We stayed one night and the magic game was commingon the next day so I asked if we could hang out at the hotel for the day and use the laugne bar to watch the game they told us no problem. They had plenty of pools and bas/resturuants, close to everything but also quite. I would def. go back again already seing if they have anything comming up soon.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Family Getaway”
Reviews.Author: hockeymomfromME
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful family getaway at the Daytona Beach Resort. Not once did my kids (ages 10 and 14) ever say they were bored. Between the pools, hot tubs and beach there was plenty to entertain them from first thing in the morning until night. The staff was friendly and courteous. Our oceanfront suite was spacious and very clean. I loved the huge bathroom. We shopped at the Publix across the street and stocked up on breakfast and lunch food as well as snacks and drinks. We were minutes away from area restaurants for dinner. The poolside bar was open and the drinks were comparatively priced. Music played continuously by the pool which was a pleasant. I can not think of anything negative about my stay. One afternoon during lunch time, the management team hosted a luncheon for the resort employees, this said a lot to me, they value their employees and in return this produces happy staff. We would definitely book another trip to this resort. The staff was constantly polishing, washing and even painting to preserve the appearance of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in Daytona”
Reviews.Author: sjhousman
Reviews.Content: We will definitely stay here on our next trip to Daytona Beach. We could not find anything wrong with this place. All the staff was very friendly and helpful. Our room was very nice. There were 6 of us (2 adults & 4 children) and we had plently of room and the best part was the private balcony overlooking the beach. It was GREAT!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay for Great Price!!!”
Reviews.Author: Nard_Dog
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I (both 27 years old) book on bookit.com and got 5 nights and flight from Minneapolis for $550/person. We upgraded to the room to ocean front room, which I definitely recommend. Ours was in the "tower" and the only down fall was that our private balcony was only 3 feet deep, could only set up 2 chairs sideways. I did notice there are some rooms with balconies 6 feet deep. During check in, had to put credit card up for $13/ night "convenience charge", which I had read about from other reviews. Got to room and was very clean and spacious. My girlfriend loved the HUGE bathrooms. We went during spring break and was expecting tons of college kids partying. There were a few, but not many. There were plenty of families and 50+ couples; Great mix. One pool outside was heated, one was not. I don't know about the baby pool. The indoor pool was heated along with two hot tubs. I read most of the reviews before I went. If you are worried that this resort is old and dirty.... don't. There was not one part of this resort that was not recently updated. Lobby is beautiful. Everything was nice. I could tell from prior reviews that this resort was in bad shape. They must have put a lot of work into it to upgrade to where it is today. There was also an outdoor wedding on the beach on Saturday and reception in the ballroom, which all looked nice. As for the staff's attitude, they were nothing but professional, kind and helpful with any question that I had. The location is decent, but if you want to see the "nightlife", you will have to cab it everywhere you go. We did not have a car while we were there so we used the Votran, its the beach side trolley (google it), and cabs a lot. I would definitely stay here again if I ever go back to Daytona Beach again.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Louis4fun
Reviews.Content: I travel to Daytona Beach frequently and stay in different places each time I go. I was very pleased with the Daytona Beach Resort and Conference Center. I was there two nights, had a lovely beach front room that was very spacious - two queen beds and a separate sitting area and a small kitchenette. The room air freshener was a little strong but once I discovered where it was placed, I was able to tone it down. Staff was very helpful and pleasant. I have read some of the other reviews critical of the staff but I could not have been more pleased. Check-in was a little slow when a group of people were all checking in at the same time but overall a very nice place to stay. I would return with my family - I think my kids would love all the pools and the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent--Will be Back”
Reviews.Author: dhoff49
Reviews.Content: Our stay was 19 days and we loved every minute of it!! The staff was very accommodating and very friendly. Our room was nothing short of wonderful and the location of it was great...No Complaints...Our mother is up in age and niether of us can do alot of walking. The front desk put us in the "perfect" suite. Housekeeping was there every day with a smile and great service too. No bugs, big plus! We ordered drinks and food from the tikki bar and was pleased with it every time. We have stayed in the huge, plush and very classy hotels too, but for the money, this is a fine hotel. As a matter of fact, I have already made reservations for may 2010 for 2 weeks, maybe we will stay even longer!! Same time, same place and same suite as last year. I am picky and somewhat of a perfectionist, if I don't like something, I am on it, I have no trouble letting anyone know if I'm unhappy!!! My niece and her husband is flying in from WY to meet up with us, they will have the suite right next door to ours. We are looking very forward to our upcoming stay at the Daytona Beach Resort...

Reviews.Title: “ATTITUDES”
Reviews.Author: Knobbyj
Reviews.Content: Booked this trip through Hotwire.Went for a memorial service,stayed two days.Booked aOne bedroom suite did not get it,was told they could give me what they wanted asked if it was at leaswt ocean view was told yes overlooked garage roof,called was told they were busy would call me back never did. Called again because something was wron g with water pipes so they squealed all night waking us constantly.Reported it was told nothing could be done because it was the weekend.called the next morning to move my room they said they would get back to me, never did.Complained when I left ,they didn't care. Also if you have a large vehicle there is no parking,can't get into parking garage and no spaces marked off for larger vehicles downstairs.WOULD NEVER STAY HERE AGAIN, AND IT IS A BEAUTIFUL HOTEL WITH A GREAT LOCATION..........

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: tornadic
Reviews.Content: I wanted to make a point to write a review for this hotel. We had a wonderful experience here. First the staff were helpful, respectful, and accommodating. They really went out of their way to treat you good. The rooms were big, roomy, clean, and had great views. We enjoyed the two balconies. Our bathroom was huge, with two sinks. Definitely nice with our family. Since we came in January, I was so pleased the hotel had a wonderfully large and warm, indoor pool with two hot tubs. Some hotel pools have indoor pools but they are too cool to be comfortable in. This was NOT the case here. Nice and warm. Also the restaurant within the hotel was very good. Ocean views, good food, good service - just wonderful. Finally, I wanted to recommend that you check out the spa services at the Terra Acqua Day Spa that is inside the hotel. The staff at the Spa were wonderful. They were very accommodating with scheduling appointments and worked around our family (we had a three year old). The atmosphere was relaxed and very professional and clean. I never hesitated to get a facial or a pedicure there. They also had some wonderful OTC items like unique jewlery and a local author's books for kids. Overall our experience was very postitive and we will definitely return whe we come to the Daytona area.

Reviews.Title: “"dirty"”
Reviews.Author: tabatha8787
Reviews.Content: I made reservations online from new york by the pictures and price about $200 a night thinking it would be nice. I rented there best room ocean front suite but it was less then impressive. The halls, elevator,room were all dirty. The room we rented had a carpet so dirty you had to keep your shoes on, coud not even walk in your socks. The room smelled like spring break just ended and there was a week long party in the room had to keep the door open for air. There has to be something better.I was going to stay at the plaza but I made a mistake and chose here. "plaza next time"

Reviews.Title: “Horrible dirty hotel”
Reviews.Author: jdrink
Reviews.Content: I have never seen such lousy service. The rooms and halways smell like mold. Housekeeping showed up too early one day, when we asked them to come back told us no. The next day, no one ever came. When I called to ask for serice, the manager was very rude with bad spanish accent, and said "no one as there to clean, come get towels." You have to sign your first born away to get a pool towel. Pool bar over priced and weak drinks and only open for limited hours. And they nickel and dime you for everything. I can why the place is empty. I would not stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Decent stay”
Reviews.Author: katerade619
Reviews.Content: After a warm reception from the front desk we checked into our room and discovered ants all over the kitchen area floor. We called the front desk and maintance showed up 5 mins later with a spray can and sprayed the whole area. There were no more ants after that. The bad thing about this hotel was that there is no resturant - they only serve breakfast and appitizers at dinner time. The good thing was that there was a Publix across the street where we were able to buy groceries. Also, a liquor store and Ruby Tuesday's down the street. We bought some extra items, but Publix accepts all returns as long as they're not opened. Since we went during the week we pretty much had the hotel to ourselves. We're able to sign out beach towels, but had to return them promptly by 11pm. However during the day there was no readily availiable front desk staff - stood there for 20 mins waiting to sign out a towel. Pools were nice and you got to look at the ocean while laying by the pool. Sun is behind the building by 3pm. Location was good as it was further down the beach from all of the touristy locations. We basically lounged around the pool/room for the 3 days that we stayed and all and all it was a good trip and a decent stay.

Reviews.Title: “INTERNET PICTURES ARE NOT REAL, BEWARE THIS PLACE”
Reviews.Author: dutchtreatOrlando
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the hotel for 4-nights in October. I wish I had found this website prior to making any arrangements to stay there. BEWARE of the pictures on their website. They are completely "doctored". If you look at the picture of the hotel from the "air", they have "whited out" all of the huge air conditioning units on top of the roof, which when you look out your window, that's all you see. Yes the water is off in the distance, but the roof on the southeast side of the building, and the parking lot roof on the northwest side of the buidling ruin the entire effect. The restaurant is NOT OPEN. Nor is there room service. They have one or two flaky bartenders. You are lucky to get your $8.50 drink or glass of wine in less than 1/2-hour. The spa is rediculously overpriced, $60.00 for a very basic pedicure, with 20% gratuity added on. Give me a break! The spa staff, is one person. If you want more than one service they have to call some one in. The rooms are dated and dirty. They have no chairs on the beach, (you can rent a chair for $25.00 per day from a local), and in order to get a towel you have to go into the lobby, sign your life away, and return it by the end of the day. Why they don't have towel service out by the pool is beyond me. You must be clear if you want a room with a balcony that you can actually sit on. Alot of the rooms (ours) had a walk out balcony only. I specifically asked for a room with a balcony, told reservations that I wanted to be able to "sit out on the balcony, and just watch the water". What I got was a 1-/2 foot piece of concrete, that overlooked a row of about 30-air conditioners. The service compeltely sucks, from the front desk, to the housekeeping, to the bar (the picture of the "tiki" bar on line doesn't even look like the same place). In reality is is a shabby concrete dirty structure with some palm leaves on top of it. I am not kidding, I have NEVER stayed at a place with such poor service. If you order food from the bar, the bartender disappears for about 1/2 hour, then returns with something very similar to airline food. Also, the gym shown on line does not look anything like the real thing. I don't know how these people get a way with this false advertising. I really can't say one good thing about this place. Stay with the Hiltons and the Crowne Plaza's, you get what you pay for, and if you can't afford that, stay in a tent on the beach, I'm that serious. P.S.,, the wi-fi in the rooms does not work, and neither did the dish network t.v., very fuzzy, and not many chanels.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place In Daytona Beach”
Reviews.Author: BouncyPouncy
Reviews.Content: From the moment we entered the hotel everyone was genuinely friendly, and helpful. Our one bedroom suite was clean and very nicely decorated. Our 2 sink bathroom was huge! The pools, spa, laundry room, and sauna were all clean and working. I think we used every amenity they had available, and each one met our expectations. We did our research before booking. We knew that it was a green hotel, so we were not expecting fresh towels each day. We knew that there was a resort fee, and that there was $140 hold on my credit card acct when I checked in. So when you research there are no surprises. I was skeptical about eating or cooking out cookware that was supplied by the hotel, even that was great! We ordered food poolside, and purchased products from the spa, and was able to charge it to the room. I didn't have to carry cash or credit cards around the resort. Across the street is Publix, Walgreens, Payless, Dollar tree, licquor store,every thing you need wiithin walking distance. Our stay was PERFECT. We will be back again next year!

Reviews.Title: “Front desk confusion”
Reviews.Author: jmarroq
Reviews.Content: First the positive: For Daytona, it is nice. It was gutted and redone recently, and the tower rooms look new. Some of the non-tower rooms are very spacious, and you can get a good view of the beach in them. There are many pools/hot tubs to choose from, so it doesn't get too crowded. It is on the northern part of Daytona Beach, walking distance to Ormand Beach so it is a lot quieter than the boardwalk area. It would be a nice place to hold an event, due to the size of the hotel, but I would be afraid to do that due to the poor service. Now the negative: The lobby still looks 1970s with the mirrors, the foam tile ceilings, the old doors and windows, ugly flooring, and the gaudy metallic garbage cans, etc. The tower rooms have potential, but the green curtains, blah bedspreads, green carpet and 1980s furniture is bad. The non-tower part of the hotel does not look gutted to me. The doors and windows still look very commercial and 1960s to me. Those rooms are also a bit more run down, and are not as nicely done as the tower rooms. The beds are lumpy. We saw some suspicious stains on the carpet and furniture too (yuck!) There is also quite a bit of outside noise, especially when facing the street. I read somewhere that one of the pools was supposed to be heated, but they felt pretty cold to me... even the kids pool was freezing. I am not crazy about cars driving on the beach. You get lots of young people out cruising, which can lead to mischief and it is also quite dangerous for the beach goers who aren't aware of it, and the little ones. Everything in this hotel is way overpriced except for the rooms. I wanted a pedicure and they had to call a local employee to come in. The staff is not normally there...they are on call. She finally arrived but forgot some of her equipment, so she had no scissors. She had to file my toenails down instead of cutting! No cutical clipper either. The food is OK depending what you order. The hamburgers are not good. The guests come from all walks of life, which leads to problems, like missing pool towels. Now you have to wait for the busy front desk staff to give you towels and sign them in and out. Can't they do this outside so we don't have to walk around the lobby all wet? The front desk has always been a mess. It takes forever to check in. We got an email in writing the last time we rented with family. It stated that we had specific rooms and that they were adjoining. When we got there, after a long drive, we had to wait an hour for them to straighten out a mess. They had rented the rooms to someone else. We eventually got bigger rooms, but we wanted our own room, not someone elses. No one apologized and my husband was visibly upset. Instead of trying to calm him down by saying "we are so sorry we messed up. I see you have it in writing that you reserved specific rooms, including your own. I know you have driven a long way and would like to get settled immediately, so let me get you another adjoining room as quickly as possible. I will get you the nicest room we have, etc..." you get my point. Instead, we got incompetent front desk staff who were rude and wanted us to pay double what we were supposed to pay, so they could fix the problem. One of them told her boss that my husband yelled at her, and I didn't hear any yelling. The boss came out and YELLED at my husband and myself. Extremely unprofessional. This is no Marriott, let me tell you. The service is horrible. Even the little convenience store they have doesn't carry toiletries and closes around dinner time. I always find expired items for sale, including milk. I don't even know why they have that store. Vending machines would be better. Luckily, there is a Publix and Walgreens across the street. The best thing that could happen to this place is for a huge hotel chain to buy them out so they can be a real hotel and not a condo with staff that has no clue about hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “Caution Advised”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoKen60657
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights. The hotel bills you for the first night upon making the reservation. There is also a $100 deposit refundable deposit. I was not aware of this until checking in although in all fairness it was noted on the reservation confirmation. Upon arriving at the hotel I discovered it was a condominium hotel; that was the first condo hotel experience for me; would not do that again. Our room was the standard hotel room. I was looking forward to having a balcony. However, the balcony was only about two feet deep at most. I wanted a balcony with chairs so we upgraded to an ocean front room with full balcony. The $100 deposit fee, which I never encountered before, put me on the defensive. So I called the front desk from each room and noted every scratch and stain I observed. But then a bigger problem was noted in the upgraded room. The kitchen was crawling with ants. I complained to the front desk. The clerk said "Well, this is Florida" but offered to change rooms. We declined but requested that maintenance spray. The maintenance man said he could take care of the kitchen but that wasn't the source of the problem. They ostensibly were coming from the outside via the living room carpet. With that we again changed rooms. Our latest suite was nice (as was the previous suite except for the ants). But again, being on guard, I made a list of nine scrathes, scrapes and stains and delivered it to the front desk so I wouldn't be accused of damaging property. Had never done this before. A second shift front office clerk didn't seem pleased when I asked her to make a copy and initial receipt. I was somewhat paranoid at this point. Our first night's stay was interrupted by noisy neighbors at 1:00 AM in the connecting room next door. Re having a balcony, if you want to sit there, request a full-size balcony, not what they refer to as a step-out balcony. Forget about eating at the hotel. Don't be deceived by the fine dining internet photo with burgundy table clothes and wine glasses. They closed the full service restaurant in October 2008. It only offers the poolside cabana menu. Stepping in early one evening, the place was empty and the decor barren. There is a carry-out place where you can purchase pre-packaged food items to take to your room or poolside. Fortunately, you can get a hearty breakfast at Denny's across the street. Also, there a couple of good local restaurants just north of the hotel. One on the east side of the street is Barnacles. On the other side and a bit farther north is The Charlie Horse. When it came time to check out, I called the front desk to have someone inspect the room before departing. A housekeeper stopped by and made a perfunctory inspection, throwing some bathroom towels on the floor in the process. I thought that was the inspection. Apparently not. As I was ready to leave a housekeeping supervisor arrived to inspect the room. She waited for me to leave. I said I want to remain for the inspection. She retorted that I might do something after she left. I said I will leave with you. She gave the place a thorough going over looking in and at everything. She even turned on each of the TVs stating that some people pour water into the back of the TV. (You've got to be kidding!) She then phoned the front desk and gave the all clear. We left the room together. The hotel staff was extremely friendly except for housekeeping and one desk clerk. In conclusion, I would not here again as there was too much hassle.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch Hotel, Customer Service, Spa, Location - Never relaxed and enjoyed myself as much as I did here!”
Reviews.Author: BrnEyes789
Reviews.Content: After my extended stay at DBR over 35 nights this past summer, I must give this hotel a "THUMBS UP"! ~ ~ I have traveled around Florida I have returned back to DBR where I was comfortable to know I was getting a great place to enjoy my vacation at a competitive price! In total I stayed in 3 different rooms and ALL OF THEM were Ocean front with a kitchen and living room area. They where clean (and I am a clean nut), well stocked, and beautiful! Housekeeping is the only department I had to be creative with - and it keep me thinking of how I could make it easier to get "my needs met" with less pressure on them (I don't like to be bothered often :)! ~ The Front Desk and Management worked with my crazy schedule beautifully, Security made me feel safe the entire stay, the restaurant/bar/store staff where all "too kind" and made me feel at home, too. (Revive, The Reef & Reflections). The Spa; The Terra Aqua Spa and I go to "know" one another very well - it's a fun and relaxing place to go. They also offer ofther items such as jewlry, purses, candles, and sunglasses to mention a few items. Very unique! Have fun, I have!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is OK, but management needs a lesson in customer service!!”
Reviews.Author: Traveler3990
Reviews.Content: My second night at the hotel I came back to the hotel with my family and there was no parking at all!! They had some kind of conference going on. I parked in the drop off lane and waited 5 minutes for someone to finally come to the front desk. The night manager told me there is nothing she can do that I should just wait until they start leaving at midnight!! She told me I could go get valet but that I would have to pay for it and find my car in the morning. I paid an extra fee for the parking and now I had to park off site. She would also not credit my account anything and just shrugged her shoulders at me!! Fed up I just parked offsite and went to bed. In the morning I complained again to the manager on duty and he said the same thing. He refused to credit me anything. I said "you know I will never come back here with this level of service and you really don't care do you?". His reply was "No". This guy should be fired!! Never have I been treated with such disrespect at a hotel especially from a manager!!. I will never return after that and I go to Daytona alot living in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed in Staff/Service - Nice property”
Reviews.Author: westorlando
Reviews.Content: I had a large family get together at this property with nearly 40 friends and family in 11 rooms. I worked for months with a very friendlly and helpful staff person to coordinate rooms. Upon arrival, one person in our block of 10 rooms didn't get their room because as the front desk put it "they gave it as a comp night to someone". So basically there were teenagers in the room that was given to them for free by someone on the staff. The worse part is I have the confirmation from the hotel with a guarantee on the specific room number for that night. Also, the teens were up late partying which woke up the babies in the next room... The front desk was not very helpful even though we had it in writing that we were supposed to have that room. Along with that we were promised connecting balconies and rooms with seperate living areas, etc. I think the hotel is quick to oversell and under deliver. The restaurant I believe is closed and room service doesn't answer the phones. The housekeepers were friendly when you saw them and the staff around the pool was great. I think management is in need of improvment. Save your $$ on the spa also! We got a discount because I arranged for over 10 services. However most of our party had a bad experience. For the price you pay, you expect well trained professionals offereing excellent services. We had someone get a steamer dropped on their stomach and burned, and a bottle of lotion dropped on thier face, we had cold lotions in massages, pedicures without leg and foot massages and many other stories to tell. Almost everyone that went to the spa said they wished they would have saved their money! The rooms, pool, lobby, etc was clean and nice. No problems there - just a little disappointed with the staff and service and inability to accomodate a group well!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: dkelsey
Reviews.Content: I rented a private condo at this resort for 5 nights for the July race. I was a little leery because of some of the previous reviews about the resort. I was pleasantly surprised at what a nice resort it was. It was clean, the staff was great, the pools were fun, the pool bar was really fun - good drinks - great bartenders. The location is amazing. It was conveniently located by grocery, great restaurants, liquor store. The views were just incredible. We were in a corner unit on the 11th floor. It was immaculate. It was so quiet it was hard to believe there were other people staying there. I will definitely stay at this resort when we visit again. I am a picky traveler and I wouldn't change anything! Great vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible smelly room.”
Reviews.Author: BoscoToronto
Reviews.Content: I stayed there during the Daytona Races in July with my son. The lobby and pool area are both great and the day staff was wonderful. I have to say the room was also very quiet, considering the hotel was full. The room was a single unit facing the road. It was smelly and smelt of a damp musty smell. Two nights in a row we received no towels from the maid. The night staff was rude when we called for some towels. When - on the third day - we actually had towels they were tiny, green, and looked like old pool towels. We found a 3 inch cockroach in the bathroom the last night and made for less then memorable last night. Thankfully the racing was fantastic and it made our trip memorable. It was the worst place I have stayed in, in the last 5 years and I travel often.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay...”
Reviews.Author: Capazools
Reviews.Content: We have made several trips to the Daytona Beach area. This hotel by far has been the nicest we have stayed in. Although we enjoyed the Hilton (Oceanwalk) last year we like the layout of this hotel much better!!! Daytona Beach resort is exactly like the pictures show. We stayed in an Oceanfront one bedroom room. It was very spacious. The bathroom was big. The whole room was very clean! The beds were extremely comfortable. The pillows were excellent. So much so my daughter wants one just like the ones in the room. I did take my laptop and the interent connection (4th floor room) was excellent. I never lost connection the entire time. The balcony furniture was nice...NOT your typical hard plastic chairs. The sliding glass door was the newer hurricane doors (very nice). Airconditioner worked fine and was not that noisy. Parking was awesome!!!! We stayed on the 4th floor and parked on the 4th floor. The door to the parking garage was right near our room. It was so convienient not having to lug everything on the elevator. Plus parking in the garage kept the sun off the cars and made them cooler. No extra cost for parking. Loved the layout of the outdoor amenities. They had two nice sized pools oceanfront (which is why we would choose this hotel over Hilton oceanwalk). They were clean with lots of pool chairs. Loved turning the pool chair around and looking out at the ocean while laying there. Also they had a separate childrens pool oceanfront with two mushroom shaped waterfalls. Pools were always clean. They also have an indoor pool and two hottubs. Very nice! We used the hottubs briefly each day after we were done on the beach. The indoor pool area was kept clean and looked updated. One thing we like also was to get back up to the hotel (pool area) you had to have an access card which cuts down on people just running up and using the pools that aren't staying there. They have three different shower things to clean the sand off when you get off the beach also. Over all very nice! Will be returning here a few more times this summer! Trying to think of one thing to complain about...but can't think of any! The staff was very prompt in bringing us extra hotels when we requested them. I can't imagine someone NOT having an enjoyable experience at this hotel. Awesome view! Awesome price! Awesome hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Clean Facility...Good For Kids”
Reviews.Author: mightyoak11111
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this facility for an extended period of time. It's conveniently located next to Publix and other shopping establishments. Pluses include cleanliness, several swimming pools, hot tubs, and laundry rooms. Internet is not always available in the rooms. If that is a priority of yours, you may either want to stay at a different hotel or simply use the internet located in the lobby and main hallway of the hotel. I would stay here again, however, my recommendation is to RENT FROM A UNIT OWNER rather than the hotel itself and SAVE A LOT. If you book your reservation through the hotel or the internet, you will pay twice as much than if you go directly through an owner. Either way, you will enjoy your time here but why not do it less expensive. By the way, "Pizza, Wings, n Things" located across the street from the hotel is a great place to eat a good chicken sandwich and watch sports. Again, I would recommend this facility BUT go through a unit owner rather than the hotel and save a lot.

Reviews.Title: “very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: flanativeOrlando_Fl
Reviews.Content: When i came across their website I was excited because they had everything that i was looking for, pool bar, restaurants in hotels and rooms service. When we got there and checked into our room (riverview) it was tiny. I know sometimes looks can be deceiving on the internet so I can't blame that on them. We did change our room to an oceanfront and that was a nice room with the exception of a musty smell, which did clear up after turning the air on and opening the door for a while. We woke the next morning and went downstair to eat breakfast at the restaurant and that is when we found out that it had been closed since October of 08', then later that day for lunch we discovered that there was not room service as well. The pool bar was nice but it closed at 6 oclock and their seemed to always be plenty of people still wanting to be served food & drinks at the pool. The entire atmosphere there seemed almost as if the place was "going under" and it was just a matter of time before it closed. I can't explain it exactly, it was just weird because the place has a lot of potential and for the most part is clean but for a place of that size it seemed like they were extremely understaffed and couldn't stay afloat. I usually stay at the Hilton in Daytona and thought that this would be comparable (viewing their website) as far as ammenities go....restaurants, room service etc. WRONG WRONG WRONG. Also we did not get the 2 bottles of water daily or housekeeping daily.

Reviews.Title: “The Resort Was A Perfect As Last Year”
Reviews.Author: Oceanut2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the resort last summer and thoroughly loved the place. Our intention was to stay again this year but after reading the reviews I almost changed my mind. I went back and forth with the decision, but in the end I could not imagine the place would have gone down hill that far in just one year. So I booked anyway and I am so glad I did. The place was as great as before. Extremely clean, the staff was very attentive, friendly and helpful (go Shelley). The maid staff was wonderful and extremely friendly. We always had clean towels and anything else we needed. The pool deck and pool bar were awesome as well. I am so glad I didn't let the reviews sway my decision to stay there again. It was wonderful as usual. Already planning my trip again for next year. Signed, Extremely Satisfied Customer!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: piercetd
Reviews.Content: This resort was first class. The rooms were very spacious over looking the ocean. One of the cleanest hotels I have been to in awhile. The pools are nice and the resort employees were helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Trip Ever - Place is run down”
Reviews.Author: HeatherPAtlantaGA
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband and 4 kids stayed here for a week in April 2009 for Spring Break. While we were here, we heard so many complaints from different people. Everyone at the front desk was there to complain. Housekeeping is rude and awful. They will come late in the evening. You have to practically beg for toilet paper or extra towels. Don't even dial 0 from your room, because you will not get anyone. They just let the phone ring and ring. Everywhere around this place, you will get harrassed by the TimeShare people across the street. Beware! The restaurant is not currently open. The so-called wireless internet service does not work in the rooms. The signal is too weak I guess. The rooms are run-down and feel dirty. We will never stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “They saved my life & reputation...You must stay here!”
Reviews.Author: ms_ga_black
Reviews.Content: This Hotel saved me....I Was Originally SUPPOSED to stay at the La Playa Hotel but if you read there review page you will know why I didn't stay there. Well me and 3 other friends went to this hotel and meet Shelly who was working the front desk she was HELLA NICE... Hooked us up with a room that was $300 cheaper than the hotel that we planned on staying at. Our experience was wonderful everyone was super nice but my KUDOS GOES TO SHELLY super cool. I would recommend that you stay here we had a geat time. they have 2 outdoor pools and outdoor kiddie pool w/ a heated inside pool and 2 hot tubs w/ and outdoor full Bar they were great can't say enough about them

Reviews.Title: “great stay in a great location”
Reviews.Author: crlg
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 weeks in an oceanfront condo. which had a separate bedroom with TV and open concept kitchen=livingroom with TV, and a patio poolside with patio chairs. The rooms were very clean and the pools both outside & inside were great. The room service was a little lacking as they missed leaving coffee, water , and newspaper a couple of days(part of the 12.00 resort fee)and missed doing our room entirely one day but the front staff was excellent and quickly corrected these small problems. The locatio n is great with a plaza containing a Publix groc, Walgreens, and Ruby Tuesday across the street and many restaurants within walking distance. Overall a very enjoyable place and we will return.

Reviews.Title: “Average Experience”
Reviews.Author: SunshineRandR
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location and has a wonderful view of the ocean. Rooms were nice and the price was reasonable however service was terrible. Was not told until we arrived that a 12% additional charge was required. Would have been nice if they had told us this up front. Maid service for our room left alot to be desired. Our room didn't get cleaned until 4:00pm. When we brought this to their attention after the first day (Sunday) they blamed it on having a lot of check outs. However it never got cleaned until 4:00 pm every day. They never vaccumed the carpet which naturally being on a beach you are going to bring sand in on your feet or shoes. Sheets on the beds were never changed. At least 30% of the lounge chairs in the pool area were broken. Pool bar was rarely opened and when it was, it closed promptly at 6:00pm even when it was busy. Internet access was $10 for first 10 minutes and $1 per minute there after. Most places don't charge. They had a military ball one evening and would not allow guests to walk in the hallway outside the ballroom. We had to walk outside one end of the hall and back in the other side. This was very inconsiderate of paying guests.

Reviews.Title: “More rules than catholic school”
Reviews.Author: BobFNJ
Reviews.Content: The place was not what we expected. Restaurant was closed, the pool bar opened and closed at the bartenders whim and when we asked whether the BBQ grill was gas or charcoal, we were told that it was theirs and not for use by guests. You had to sign towels out at te front desk and if they weren't returned at days end, you had to buy them. And the room service, not only was the toilet paper the cheapest brand I've ever used, but we had to ask for some every day.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place but Service is Not Great”
Reviews.Author: Greatcaper
Reviews.Content: This place is a decent hotel, but for the price, we did expect better. It was in good shape and the room was nice, but we did not have daily maid service and when she did come, there were a couple of days when she did not even make the bed!! Frankly, I believe the place is understaffed, but I have no real way of knowing that. All the employees that we interacted with were friendly and the resort has a great location. We would certainly go back to this resort, but I might look for a lower price the next time around.

Reviews.Title: “Really Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: emba33
Reviews.Content: You will not find the "Days Inn" name anywhere on this hotel (although I understand they are affiliated with this location). This is a classy place with a beautiful location. We ordered our trip through Expedia and were upgraded for the same price to a full suite with microwave, stovetop (induction stovetop), fridge, pots, dishes. The room had a nice view of the beach and pools with a balcony (including chairs and a small table). There was security, and the front desk was helpful. The beach speaks for itself ... at this time of the year, it was warm enough to swim in the ocean, the pools ... and the indoor whirlpools. It's a little pricier, but you get what you pay for. If you can get it around $100/night, it would be a really good deal. I think the slightly higher rate keeps the rowdier-type clients away. There were little fire pits poolside for a really beautiful setting. -- Emba33

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and People for anyone looking for a SB vacation”
Reviews.Author: milton0204
Reviews.Content: The location was excellent we were walking distance from all the hotspots. Customer service was excellent. SHELLY at the front desk was patient and very helpful when it came to us checking out. She was by far one of the best receptionist that I have come in contact with so far , ( and I travel a lot)..... I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to experience a good time not only for the location right by the beach, but the amenities that come with the hotel such as the sauna and the massage therapy sessions. Happy Traveling.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but....”
Reviews.Author: pletzkeb
Reviews.Content: Six night stay in a 2 queen studio with ocean view and small kitchen. Room was nice with comfortable beds and good quality linens and towels. Hotel staff friendly. The hotel advertises a restaurant and room service on their website and in the room, but has neither. There is a bar with a limited menu, appetizers, salads and sandwiches, and a small store with coffee and snacks. Housekeeping was a problem. We received no service the second day, and every day of our stay (except the day the housekeeping manager checked our room) we had to call for supplies such as water, toiletries, coffee, kitchen towels, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible service”
Reviews.Author: RedbirdFL
Reviews.Content: We had a large group conference at the DBR in January and had many problems. The service from most of the employees was poor. Our participants were treated rudely on several occasions. Many of our sleeping rooms were not cleaned on a daily basis. The ballroom wasn't kept clean either. They seemed to only have one person on duty the whole time we were there to take care of needs in the ballroom. This was a conference with 400 people, so the poor guy was doing the best he could, but it was too much for one person to handle. This is an annual conference and we will go elsewhere next year. The location is great, but the customer service is terrible.

Reviews.Title: “Very diappointing”
Reviews.Author: calibaby27
Reviews.Content: We should have left right away. When you pull up to the front door and see employees smoking and not one acknowledged us, we should have realized that this was NOT a first class place.We could see people sitting in the back room eating and had to wait until lunch was over to check in. The restrooms had trash over flowing the cans and on the floors. When we entered the room, there was a terrible odor so we asked to move to another. The next one wasn't much better but the odor was not as strong. We found a used washcloth under the sink and trash in the can under the sink. The room could have been nice if it was cleaner. The pool areas, were nice. This might have been a really nice place once but it is being neglected and is being rundown. It's the little things likethe dust bunnies and candy wrapper under the bed, the trash on the floor in the rest rooms. The location is good but the hotel needs cleaning and tlc.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gracielou22
Reviews.Content: We actually booked a different hotel but when we arrived we were very disappointed in the other hotel. We called Daytona Beach Resort and Emily showed us a few rooms and we changed our reservations - DBR actually gave us a better room for the same price as the other hotel!!! DBR is very family friendly and clean!! Even in the middle of July it wasn't over crowded. The Hotel is emmaculate and very well kept. They have security and private parking! We felt so much better staying here than at the other hotel. The staff is very friendly! DBR is just an awesome hotel!! You can't go wrong booking here!!! We just booked our 2009 vacation with them!!! I can't wait!!! Thanks DBR for a wonderful Vacation!!! PS - there is a Denny's right across the street and a Publix and Walgreens in walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RMRd
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel. Will defiantly go back!

Reviews.Title: “Substandard Service, Smelly, Overcharged,Overrated”
Reviews.Author: DispleasedAtHotel
Reviews.Content: During BikeWeek hotel was booked solid so no room change cld be offered. Our room stank of unknowns plus cigarette smoke in this Non-Smoking Hotel. The maid service was horrendous - we ask for sheets changed daily -- we get the bed made with no sheet change; towels were taken never replaced. One tiny bottle of shampoo.
