Room never vacuumed/cleaned. Maid service very superficial and unsatisfactory. Really nice beach front firepit/lounge area - except smoking galore in this non-smoking hotel! Booked thru Travelocity which stated $12 service fee per reservation. The hotel insists that per reservation actually means per night -- not in my book - so don't know if Travelocity is misrepresenting hotel charges or hotel not being truthful; all around displeased with hotel considering rates. Wld not stay there again and wld not recommend.

Reviews.Title: “okey dokey”
Reviews.Author: mammy1234
Reviews.Content: We were looking for great pools, nice views, kitchen and near activities. The kitchen was useful, pools nice enough, view beautiful but not within walking distance of anything fun to do. Travelocity confirmed my reservation for a one bedroom oceanfront but hotel had us in a studio; they consented to "upgrade" us to the 1 bedroom we paid for. Tip: get a private balcony-we opted for the larger one bedroom that had a shared balcony. Would next time stay nearer to the boardwalk area for more options close by.

Reviews.Title: “not what I expected”
Reviews.Author: AlabamaTwinmom
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Daytona Resort and Conference Center. We stayed in an oceanfront studio. The view was OK except there really was no balcony, just an oceanfront walkway with chairs. So to enjoy the view you had to sit outside or leave your curtain open and allow everyone to see entirely into your room. The room was fairly clean when we got there, except for a filthy microwave. However it was not cleaned again the whole time we were there. We did get fresh towels and they took the garbage out, but no wiping, vacuuming, etc. As for cleanliness and view we stayed in an oceanfront efficiency at Emerald Shores a few years back and it was much better... and cheaper. Some positives about the Resort and Conference center are their parking deck and their kiddie pool.

Reviews.Title: “Overall Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ilovewashingtondc
Reviews.Content: We got a oceanfront room for 3 nights. You walk in and the first thing you see is the gorgeous lobby with the stunning floors and upscale decor. In addition to the helpful and courteous staff, security is increased with security cameras located in most areas, including elevators and the lobby. The rooms also feature hotel access-card modules (instead of keys). All rooms, including guest rooms, are suite style and fully furnished. Comfortable bedding, ultimate view and wonderful kitchen. When I stepped in the shower and pulled the shower curtain, a HUGE roach-looking thing was up-side down right in front of the tub laying on the floor!!! OMG!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! An employee came up right away and explained that they are only a common water-bug that is seen in Florida, and they are NOT roaches. From there, everything was OK again. In our first room, they had just painted that day...OMG. *****By the way...the bug was in the 2nd room.*****So, we asked to move next door (into the 2nd room) and they agreed. It smelled so much better. They had 2 large heated pools and 1 kiddie pool outside, along with a bar in the center of it all. Inside, there are 2 jacuzzis and 1 large heated pool!! LOVE IT!!!!!!!! Overall great stay. Would probably come back.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant Surprise!”
Reviews.Author: Katrina79
Reviews.Content: My family and I just returned from spending the weekend at Daytona Beach Resort & Conference Center. What a wonderful surprise! I haven't been to Daytona in years even though I live less than an hour away. I have two children, 8 and 9 years old, so I wanted to make sure we picked a place that was appropriate for families. This was perfect for us. Our oceanfront studio was a very nice size and had a full size fridge, a two burner stove, and a microwave. All of the furnishings/appliances appeared to be brand new. We were a little concerned when we saw that our room was very near an elevator. It turned out to be one of the quietest rooms I have ever stayed in. Our balcony overlooked one of the pools and the ocean. While the children rested in the room, my husband and I sat on the balcony and enjoyed the music that was played poolside and relaxed. My husband and I agree that we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “What a great get-away”
Reviews.Author: vgivens3
Reviews.Content: This was the best stay I have had in a long time. I came to Daytona Beach as a first time visitor from georgia. It took me two weeks to keep trying to find a hotel to my liking. Something kept drawing me back to this hotel. The pictures and all the information line up with the hotel when you arrive. The staff is friendly and helpful and the rooms are spacious and very bright. I loved the side view of the ocean and also being able sit out at night by the pool and watch the fireworks. I would definately reccommend this hotel to family and friends. We are considering a family reunioun here because its just in the perfect spot. I really enjoyed my weekend and the celebration of my birthday. See you in a couple of months, so I can re-live what I have experienced the first time. Comfort, peace and pleasure. Thank you so much

Reviews.Title: “There are many better choices”
Reviews.Author: frequenttraveler58
Reviews.Content: I don't know why they call this a resort. It's not a resort, it's a HOTEL. There are no spa services,no concierge, no massages or body treatments, no basketball, no putting green, no tennis court, no nightly entertainment. Really, it's just a hotel with a pool. I guess they call it a 'resort' so that they can be justified in charging a 'resort' fee which is BOGUS. Music is loudly played at poolside at 9:00 a.m. sharp at poolside. It was too bad that I'm a late sleeper and didn't appreciate getting woken up so early being that my room faced the pool. For the price we paid for the 'resort', I would've thought that the beach lounges and umbrellas would have been included, not an extra charge. The location was off the beaten track so you definitely need a car. I didn't feel that the lobby was anything to write home about - very cold and barren. I think there are so many other better choices. Next time, I won't be staying here, more likely I'll stay at the Hilton or the Plaza which are better locations and are true'resorts'

Reviews.Title: “It Was Grrrrrrrrrrrreat!”
Reviews.Author: LakerB
Reviews.Content: After spending hours debating the pros and cons of the top 20 Daytona Beach hotels here, we finally settled on the Daytona Beach Resort and Conference Center for 3 primary reasons: oceanfront room with large, furnished balcony; kitchen with microwave, stove, coffeemaker and full-size fridge; and a roomy separate bedroom with 2 queen beds (pullout couch in family room). It's their "one-bedroom oceanfront condo." Let me start by saying that it is SO worth it to have a room with a kitchen (every room has one here), especially in our case with 6 people. I spent $203 at Publix when we arrived, and we ate all of our meals (9 total) in the room. I don't even want to start doing the math on what it would have cost for all 6 of us to eat those 9 meals out. The room was updated and clean, the service was great, the location was perfect, the pools, pool furniture and pool area were very well maintained, the elevators were fast, and the common areas were immaculate. It's obvious that this hotel is working real hard to renew its image along with its $34 million transformation. There's a Publix across the street, in a shopping plaza that also has a Bealls, a dollar store and a dozen or so smaller shops. There's a Walgreens and a beachy souvenir-type store across the street, as well. Publix and Walgreens have everything you need for the beach and pool--from coolers to floats to fishing poles to chairs and sunscreen. The "action" by the Pier/Ocean Walk was a 5-minute drive north. A big plus is the covered parking garage manned by a security guard. In addition to keeping our car safe and out of the sun, the garage also gave easy access to our room. We parked on the third level and walked to our third-floor room through an interior access door from the garage. Both times I called the front desk for service (once for extra pillows and once for a faucet issue), there was someone at our door within minutes--and the pillows were even toasty warm! All of the employees we came in contact with were friendly and helpful. We didn't eat at the restaurant, use the fitness or business center or frequent the poolside tiki bar, but all were open and being enjoyed by other guests. There also was a laundry room on our floor; possibly on every floor. The beach was just steps out the gate of the pool area; a company that rents beach umbrella/lounge chair combos sets up out front each morning. I had dreaded the "cars on the beach" thing, but it really wasn't bad at all; it may be worse during busier times of the year. There's a lifeguard on duty directly to the left of the hotel. Although the hotel website had the 1-bedroom oceanfront condo listed for $239/night, we got it through Expedia for $171.75/night + we found an Expedia coupon code that subtracted $10/night + we got a free $50 gas card by using our MasterCard to reserve the room. We ended up paying a total of $177.40/night when adding taxes and the $12/day resort fee back in. Not bad for a great hotel and a great room with a great view! A comment on the resort fee: I read a handful of reviews by people who were not happy with the $12/day fee and gave the hotel a lower rating because of it. The hotel says the fee covers the covered parking garage, a daily USA Today newspaper at your door, 2 bottles of water a day, local calls, wireless internet access and access to the fitness center and resort amenities. We appreciated most of those things but think the hotel would be better off building the fee into their room rates and saying those things are "free" rather than charging a daily fee. That way, guests who don't use any of those things won't feel like they're being forced to pay for something they don't want. If I had to provide any constructive feedback at all, it would be that there's not a lot to do aside from the beach and pools--and no entertainment is within walking distance. It seems a resort of this size would offer a game room, a putting green, shuffleboard, basketball, a mini-movie theather, a common area with TVs or something as entertainment in addition to the pools and hot tubs. We had a car, so we ended up going to Congo River to play mini golf one night and walking around the Ocean Walk entertainment complex another night. We had a great trip overall, and I wouldn't hesitate to recommend or stay at the Daytona Beach Resort and Conference center again in the future. If you stayed here in the past and had a not-so-great experience, it's definitely worth another try!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel on the Beach”
Reviews.Author: Soonergirl1
Reviews.Content: I came to this resort as part of a business trip. What a nice place! My colleague had an oceanfront room on the third floor and enjoyed the view and her balcony every day. My room was a very large room on the ninth floor - I had a tiny ocean view and tiny balcony, but a wall of windows facing the city! I also had a small living room area and a huge bathroom plus a fully stocked kitchen. The bed was wonderful!! I slept very well the whole time I was there except on the Saturday night I was there - there was a lot of street noise, and I had to put in earplugs. After that, I slept well. The lobby at the hotel is beautiful and the staff was very friendly and helpful. The pools are beautiful (the indoor pool is quite large for an indoor pool) and we enjoyed the live music at the pool on the weekend plus the fire pit at night. We did have trouble finding many places to eat around there - there is a Denny's, Ruby Tuesday's, Olive Garden and Red Lobster, but my colleague didn't like seafood and I am not wild about pasta, so there wasn't much left! We did eat in the hotel restaurant and had a great meal and our waiter was wonderful! I wouldn't take my small children there, but if you were with some older children or adults, it's a very nice place to eat. All in all, I had a fabulous time at this resort and enjoyed being right on the beach. We were about two miles away from the Boardwalk and pier, but considering all the noise down there, I didn't consider it a bad thing. I enjoyed my stay and intend to bring my family down there one of these days. My kids will love it!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT TIME!”
Reviews.Author: GirlsfromJAX
Reviews.Content: Looking for a quick getaway for the weekend....called the hotel day before and beat all the advertised rates online! Oceanfront studio/king...perfect. The staff were always attentive. The room clean and full kitchen.....what a nice suprise! Covered parking with 24 hour security....nice touch. Several nearby places to eat....but try "Reflections" in the hotel.....awesome! We loved the pool cabana bar and live music.....the hotel is away from the crowds....great for families or couples..... We will return!

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel...worth the stay but pick your room carefully”
Reviews.Author: rusty268
Reviews.Content: Very pleasant hotel with clean rooms and an excellent view of the ocean. We had a 3 year old with us and we were able to keep him occupied with lots of nearby attractions. Parking on the same floor as your room is a bonus but parking is at a premium when the hotel is busy. The kitchenette in our room was very nice and the fact that a major shopping center is across the road means you don't have to eat out at every meal. The gym was very small, but had enough equipment for a decent workout. Strangely enough, staff turned the other cheek when I mentioned that I had been forced to witness an old man in a Speedo (no T-shirt or shoes) on an ellipse machine ahead of me. (and yet we got a phone call from the front desk when we hung a towel to dry on our balcony) We did find that the hotel has a lot of rules to maintain a perception of propriety. Some rules are posted (no coolers on pool deck) why others are not. Towards the end of our stay, we actually started to have fun seeing how many we could ignore. (withour being a pain to other guests of course) Cleaning staff were very friendly and worked around our schedule. All 3 pools were nice, large and clean, but if you need to get to the ocean, you have to have a pass key with you to get back in. (a major pain if you are alone and if you want to swim without losing your key card) Our family did not find the front desk staff very helpful when seeking tourist info about attractions such as Disney (or even stuff close by), but for the rest they were friendly and helpful. On the ocean side, watch which room you get. A loud music system comes on precisely at 8 am and shuts off at 10 pm. (on a timer) As a result, we could not keep our balcony door open to enjoy the ocean sounds while our child slept. We raised this with the front desk on our last day and they replied that the owner had specifically requested the music be turned up. (I found it odd that my concerns were simply brushed aside, as a customer, in favour of an owner's wishes) If you stay above the third floor, you will be happy. (unless you want the lud music) We never ate in the restaurant...but the menu looks OK. (it's more suited for a business meeting than a vacation dinner with a child) Forget using the 'business center' to keep up with your e-mail. Internet access is very pricey. I recommend this hotel to any family.....

HotelInfo.Name: Daytona Beach Resort and Conference Center
HotelInfo.Address: 2700 N Atlantic Ave, Daytona Beach, FL 32118
